0.title: Wow, that's a new low: Kangana on 'Brahmāstra' figures being 70% fake
0.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has shared filmmaker Eray Mridula Cather's tweet which called the box office figures of Ayan Mukerji directorial 'Brahmāstra' to be 60-70% fake. Kangana wrote alongside a screenshot of the tweet, "Wow!!! That's a new low." Eray tweeted, "Few trade analysts are not giving #Brahmastra BO figures as they're completely manipulated...It's not just ego, it's coke-ego!"

1.title: Pic shows Tricolour flying at half-mast as India observes 1-day state mourning
1.article_body: The Tricolour is being flown at half-mast at Red Fort, Rashtrapati Bhavan, Parliament and other government buildings on Sunday as India observes one-day state mourning following the demise of UK Queen Elizabeth II. There will be no official entertainment on Sunday, according to the statement released by the Centre. The Queen passed away on September 8.

2.title: Players carry stretcher after fan suffers heart attack during Cadiz-Barca match
2.article_body: Barcelona's La Liga match against Cadiz on Saturday night was suspended for over 50 minutes after a fan suffered a cardiac arrest in the stands. Cadiz players Jose Mari and Jeremias Ledesma were seen assisting the officials in carrying a stretcher and a defibrillator during the medical emergency. Cadiz said the fan was successfully resuscitated and taken to the hospital.

3.title: Around 1,50,000 people visited revamped Central Vista yesterday: Police
3.article_body: As the revamped Central Vista Avenue was opened to public on Thursday evening after almost 19 months, a large number of people visited India Gate yesterday. Around 1,50,000 people visited the avenue on Saturday, of whom 40,000 arrived after sunset, the police officers estimated. Parking spaces were full in the evening as a huge crowd turned up, DCP Traffic said.

4.title: 'UP + Bihar = Gayi Modi Sarkar' poster surfaces outside SP's office in Lucknow
4.article_body: A poster surfaced in Lucknow outside the Samajwadi Party's (SP) office with photos of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav. "UP + Bihar = Gayi Modi Sarkar (If UP and Bihar join hands, PM Modi-led government will be ousted)," read message on the poster. "If we see political map, BJP would be nowhere," SP's IP Singh said.

5.title: Canadian Parliament to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II on Thursday
5.article_body: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said the Parliament will sit on Thursday to allow members to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II. "In addition, to accommodate Her Majesty's funeral, the opening of the session will be delayed by one day to September 20th," Trudeau added. In a previous tweet, Trudeau said the Queen was thoughtful, curious, helpful and funny.

6.title: Bus collides with tanker truck carrying fuel in Mexico; 18 killed
6.article_body: At least 18 people were killed after a bus collided with a tanker truck carrying fuel on a highway in Mexico's Tamaulipas, according to authorities. The crash left both vehicles completely burned and pictures released by the police showed that the bus was reduced to charred metal, the Associated Press reported. The truck driver apparently survived and is being investigated.

7.title: Payments giants to apply code to track sales at gun stores in US
7.article_body: Visa Inc, Mastercard Inc and American Express have said that they will implement a new merchant category code, approved by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), for US gun retailers. Gun-control activists said that the code will track purchase of suspicious weapons. The code will show where an individual has spent money but won't show the items purchased.

8.title: IIT JEE Advanced 2022 results declared
8.article_body: The Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay (IIT Bombay) has released the results for the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Advanced 2022 exam. Candidates can now check their score cards at the official JEE Advanced website - jeeadv.ac.in.  The online registration for Architecture Aptitude Test (AAT) 2022 will be open from 10 am of September 11 till 5 pm of September 12.

9.title: Veteran actor & former Union Minister Krishnam Raju passes away aged 83
9.article_body: Veteran actor and former Union Minister U Krishnam Raju has passed away at the age of 83 while undergoing treatment at a Hyderabad hospital. Known as 'Rebel Star', he acted in over 180 films and was a two-time Lok Sabha member. Condoling his demise, Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, "His passing away leaves a deep void in our Telugu cinema."

10.title: Mumbai Police bust child begging racket after baby kidnapped from station
10.article_body: A woman and her two children have been taken into custody after allegedly kidnapping a baby from Mumbai's Dadar railway station. Police checked CCTV footage as part of their probe and busted a child begging racket. The incident came to light after the baby's mother filed a missing complaint with the Borivali Government Railway Police (GRP).

11.title: India reports 5,076 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity rate stands at 1.58%
11.article_body: India has reported 5,076 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours and 11 more deaths, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,554 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country stood at 47,945, while the daily positivity rate stood at 1.58%.

12.title: Chandigarh admin fined ₹10,000 by HC, sought more jail term for drug convict
12.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court fined the Chandigarh administration ₹10,000 for seeking enhancement of jail term for a drug seizure case convict who remained in jail for two months. The court observed that the convict had no prior arrests and was found in possession of 210 grams of charas which is not a commercial quantity.

13.title: 40 students fall sick at TN school, dead lizard reportedly found in food
13.article_body: A cook and an assistant cook were suspended after over 40 students complained of nausea and vomiting after eating a midday meal at a government school in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvannamalai. The police said that the students had reportedly found a dead lizard in the food. Six of the students who fell sick were referred to a government hospital.

14.title: Woman, lover strangle husband to death, pass it as cardiac arrest in Ludhiana
14.article_body: A woman and her lover allegedly strangled her husband to death after he found out about their affair and tried to pass it off as cardiac arrest in Ludhiana. She mixed intoxicants in the victim's tea who lost consciousness, following which her lover strangled him. The accused switched off the CCTV cameras installed in the house before committing the crime.

15.title: Who’ll take his talks seriously, he was with BJP a month ago: Kishor on Bihar CM
15.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor, on being asked about Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's displeasure with him stating BJP links, said, “Nitishji isn't angry with me, it's his way of speaking.” “Who'll take his talks seriously? He was with BJP...month ago,” Kishor added. Earlier, Kumar, while responding to a question about Kishor said, “Maybe he wants to stay with BJP…help them.”

16.title: Govt refuses to share details on Agnipath scheme under RTI, says file marked 'secret'
16.article_body: The government has refused to share details about the Agnipath scheme for military recruitment under the Right to Information, saying the file has been marked "secret", according to a Defence Ministry letter. Information was sought on the inter-ministerial deliberations and reasons for introducing Agnipath to replace the existing recruitment scheme and discussion on the pay package and allowance.

17.title: Wealthy tech elite looked the other way: Zoho CEO on video of homeless fighting in US
17.article_body: Responding to a viral video of a massive fight that broke out between homeless people in San Francisco, US, Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu said, "The tragedy of San Francisco is...its wealthy tech elite have looked the other way." He further said, "The tragedy of the world is that...same tech elite is pushing the ideology on...us, calling everyone who resists bigots."

18.title: I have 4 times more supporters now: Azad post all-party meet
18.article_body: Former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad convened an all-party meeting in Jammu on Saturday and claimed that delegations from 30-35 Assembly constituencies extended their support to him and will be part of whatever party he makes. "I can safely say that four times more people have come to my support than to the meetings I held in Congress," Azad said.

19.title: 5 die in Haridwar after consuming liquor given by panchayat poll candidate
19.article_body: Five people died in two villages of Haridwar on Saturday allegedly after consuming liquor that was distributed by a panchayat poll candidate, police said. Several people were hospitalised and some of them are stated to be in serious condition, police added. However, a report from CMO said initial inquiries have ruled out consumption of illicit liquor as cause of death.

20.title: KRK shares 1st tweet after release from jail, says 'I'm back for my vengeance'
20.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan, who was arrested over derogatory tweet and molestation cases after he landed in Mumbai last month, has shared his first tweet after being released on bail. "I am back for my vengeance," KRK tweeted. Earlier, his son Faisal tweeted from KRK's Twitter account and alleged, "Some people are torturing to kill my father in Mumbai."

21.title: I don't like Swiatek very much right now, but it's okay: Jabeur
21.article_body: World number five Ons Jabeur jokingly said she doesn't like Iga Swiatek after losing to the latter in their women's singles final at the US Open 2022. "I really tried...but Iga didn't make it easy for me...I don't like her very much right now, but it's okay," she said. It was Jabeur's second straight defeat in a Grand Slam final.

22.title: 2,000 sq km of Ukraine's territory liberated since early Sept: Zelenskyy
22.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday said that about 2,000 square kilometre of the country's territory has been liberated since the beginning of September. This comes as Russia's Defence Ministry announced it will pull back troops from areas in Kharkiv amid Kyiv's counteroffensive. "In the end, it is a good choice for [Russia] to run away," Zelenskyy added.

23.title: I used to feel Karan Johar is a misfit, but now I identify with him: Anurag
23.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap stated that he initially used to feel filmmaker Karan Johar is a misfit. "The more I have discovered him, I love him a lot. I identify with him...on many things in life," Anurag added. He further said that Karan is constantly trying to change himself, adapt to situations and produce films for the younger lot.

24.title: Instagram is an envy amplifier: World's richest person Elon Musk
24.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted, "Instagram is an envy amplifier," in response to a clip of Berkshire Hathaway's Vice Chairman Charlie Munger talking about envy. "The world is not driven by greed, it's driven by envy," Munger said. Musk earlier called Instagram a "next-level thirst trap" and revealed that he has a secret account with 54 followers.

25.title: Sushant's Brahmastra enough to destroy B'wood: Late actor's sister on film
25.article_body: After the release of Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's movie 'Brahmastra', later actor Sushant Singh Rajput's sister Meetu Singh said, "Sushant's Brahmastra is enough to destroy Bollywood." "Bollywood has always wanted to dictate the public, never stopping to show mutual respect and humility...Their sorry attempt [at] winning public's love with pretentiousness has failed," she wrote on Instagram.

26.title: Pune road sees noisiest Ganesh immersion festivities since 2013 at 105.2 dB
26.article_body: At 105.2 decibels, Pune's Laxmi Road saw its noisiest Ganesh immersion celebrations since 2013 this year, reports said. Meanwhile, Khanduji Baba Chowk recorded 128 decibels at 8 am on Saturday. "This year, Puneites and Ganesh festival enthusiasts from different places were eager to participate," an official said.

27.title: Truly bringing magic of cinemas alive: Varun Dhawan on 'Brahmāstra'
27.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan on Saturday took to Instagram Stories to appreciate Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra'. The actor wrote, "Congratulations team Brahmastra. Experience this only in the theatre. Truly bringing the magic of cinemas alive on the big screen." Varun further wrote, "The [background music] the performances the vfx everything." The film is directed by Ayan Mukerji.

28.title: SpaceX launches 34 Starlink satellites in its 41st mission of 2022
28.article_body: SpaceX has successfully launched 34 Starlink satellites and AST SpaceMobile's BlueWalker 3 satellite atop a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket completing its 41st mission of 2022. The Falcon 9's first stage landed on the 'A Shortfall of Gravitas' droneship, completing SpaceX's first 14th flight of a first stage booster. SpaceX plans to launch 100 orbital missions in 2023.

29.title: The hard work, passion was magical to witness: Janhvi on 'Brahmāstra'
29.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor on Saturday praised Ayan Mukerji directorial 'Brahmāstra' on Instagram Stories, writing, "The sense of pride I felt while watching this vision come to life was truly overwhelming." She further wrote, "The hard work and passion and vision was magical to witness. Congratulations on creating something we can all feel proud to call a work of Indian cinema."

30.title: Babar is in good form, he has just been unlucky in recent games: Coach Saqlain
30.article_body: Talking about their captain Babar Azam's form in the Asia Cup 2022, Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq said the 27-year-old has just been unlucky in the tournament so far. "Babar is in good form. It's just that his luck is not going his way," stated Mushtaq. Babar has scored 10, 9, 14, 0 and 30 so far in Asia Cup.

31.title: Traffic restrictions in Bengaluru today for BJP's 'Janotsava' rally
31.article_body: The Bengaluru Police issued traffic diversions and restrictions in the city for today in view of BJP's 'Janotsava' rally to mark Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai's one year in office. In its advisory, the Bengaluru Police asked commuters moving to and from Bengaluru-Ballari road (Kempegowda International Airport road), Devanahalli road and Doddaballapura road to use alternate routes.

32.title: Essay on Udham Singh in Punjab school textbook fallacious, misleading: Historian
32.article_body: Gadri Shaheed Udham Singh Vichar Manch led by historian Rakesh Kumar has written letters to Punjab Chief Minister, Education Minister and Punjab School Education Board (PSEB) Chairman calling the chapter in class 5 textbooks titled 'Shaheed Udham' fallacious and misleading. "These facts are far from historical facts...Even the photo published in the essay does not resemble him," the letter stated.

33.title: Man brings desktop to Bengaluru coffee shop as 'office gets flooded'; pic viral
33.article_body: A picture of a man working from a Bengaluru coffee shop, where he had set up his desktop on a table, has gone viral on social media. "I just saw a group working from the Third Wave Coffee with "a full-fledged desktop setup" because their offices are flooded," a Twitter user said while sharing the picture.

34.title: In many ways, Apple is still run the way Steve Jobs set it up: CEO Tim Cook
34.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook at a recent conference said that in many ways, the company is still run the way its late Co-founder Steve Jobs set it up. Cook said he still holds Jobs' traditional 9am Monday meetings for top executives. "We don't sit around and say: 'What would Steve do?'...But...he was the best teacher I ever had," Cook added.

35.title: 23-yr-old Delhi food delivery executive dies as class 11 boy hits bike with SUV
35.article_body: A 23-year-old food delivery executive, who was off-duty and was going to meet a friend, was killed after an SUV hit his motorcycle in Delhi, police said. The SUV was driven by a class 11 student. An FIR was registered in case and the juvenile has been apprehended. The juvenile reportedly told police that he lost control of the vehicle.

36.title: 5-hour rail block on Mumbai's Central, Harbour lines today
36.article_body: Mumbai local train services will be affected on Central and Harbour lines today (September 11) as Central Railway (CR) for Mumbai division will operate a mega block for carrying out maintenance work of rail tracks. There will be a five-hour block from 11:05 am to 4:05 pm between Matunga and Mulund and between Panvel and Vashi stations.

37.title: India observes state mourning today in tribute to Queen Elizabeth
37.article_body: India is observing one day of state mourning on Sunday as a mark of respect to Britain's Queen Elizabeth II. The Queen passed away on September 8. The national flag will be flown at half-mast throughout India on all buildings where the national flag is flown regularly and there will be no official entertainment today, the government said.

38.title: Hyd man dies after falling off lorry, coming under its rear wheels
38.article_body: A 20-year-old man was crushed to death after he fell off a lorry accidentally and then came under its rear wheels in Hyderabad's Abids. The incident took place on Friday when the deceased was returning home after immersion of Ganesh idol in Hussain Sagar. The deceased's body has been taken to the Osmania General Hospital for an autopsy.

39.title: William, Kate, Harry, Meghan appear together for 1st time after Queen's death, pics viral
39.article_body: Prince William and Prince Harry and their respective wives, Kate Middleton and Meghan Markle, appeared together in public for the first time since Queen Elizabeth II's death. They appeared outside Windsor Castle and viewed the floral tributes. They also shook hands and chatted with several people. As per reports, Prince William invited his brother Harry and Megan to join them.

40.title: World number one Iga Świątek becomes first-ever woman from Poland to win US Open
40.article_body: World number one Iga Świątek defeated world number five Ons Jabeur in the women's singles final to become the first-ever woman from Poland to win the US Open title. The 21-year-old won the US Open 2022 final with a scoreline of 6-2, 7-6(7-5). Świątek has now won three Grand Slam titles, including French Open 2020 and 2022 titles.

41.title: US records its milestone 1 millionth organ transplant
41.article_body: The US recorded its one millionth organ transplant on Friday. The achievement was confirmed at 12:50 pm ET by United Network for Organ Sharing, a nonprofit that runs the only organ procurement and transplantation network in US. The first successful organ transplant occurred in 1954 in Boston when doctors transplanted kidney from 23-year-old Ronald Herrick into his twin brother Richard.

42.title: Alcaraz has beaten me a couple of times and I will seek my revenge: Ruud on US Open final
42.article_body: Ahead of his US Open 2022 men's singles final against Carlos Alcaraz, Casper Ruud said, "I hope it will be a good match. He has beaten me a couple of times and I will seek my revenge." He added, "I think if I want to beat Carlos, I'll need to play very precise with all the shots that I hit."

43.title: 2-time Olympic javelin champion and world record holder Barbora Spotakova retires
43.article_body: Two-time Olympic javelin champion and world record holder Barbora Spotakova has announced her retirement. Spotakova, who won Olympic gold in 2008 and 2012 and bronze in 2016, last competed at Diamond League in Zurich on Thursday. She's also the first woman to win three Olympic medals in javelin. Spotakova set the women's javelin world record of 72.28 metres in 2008.

44.title: Body of medical student killed in Armenia reaches India after 14 days
44.article_body: The body of Indian-origin medical student Ashutosh Dwivedi reached his hometown Madhya Pradesh's Rewa on Saturday, 14 days after his demise. The 27-year-old was allegedly killed in Armenia on the intervening night of August 27 and 28. "We're grateful to Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan for helping us bring the body. We're also grateful to...the Indian Embassy," Dwivedi's cousin said.

45.title: 2 coaches of Humsafar Express train derail in Bihar; no one injured
45.article_body: Two coaches of the Katihar-bound Humsafar Express coming from Delhi got derailed in Bihar's West Champaran district on Saturday at around 3 pm, an East Central Railway official said. The train was moving at a slow speed when the coaches jumped the tracks, the official added. He further informed that no one was injured in the incident.

46.title: Fevicol should make him brand ambassador: Prashant Kishor on Nitish
46.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Saturday joked that Fevicol should make Bihar CM Nitish Kumar its brand ambassador. He was referring to the fact that Kumar has held onto the CM's post since 2015 and before that from 2005-2014. "We've seen many alliances being made and broken in Bihar...Only [the link] between CM chair and...Kumar [doesn't break]," Kishor said.

47.title: US announces $40 million farming aid to Sri Lanka
47.article_body: The US on Saturday announced $40 million aid to Sri Lanka to help the country procure key agricultural inputs ahead of the next cultivation season. USAID Administrator Samantha Power is presently visiting the country, which is facing an unprecedented economic crisis. She said the aid will be in addition to the already-announced $6 million to assist low income farmers.

48.title: Gujarat CM launches state's 'Cinematic Tourism Policy 2022'
48.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel on Saturday launched the state's 'Cinematic Tourism Policy 2022' which aims to attract investment, develop infrastructure, raise entrepreneurial opportunity and increase jobs in the film industry. As per policy, the government will give incentives for making films, documentaries and TV series. The government will also give 100% reimbursement of registration fee.

49.title: Russia to pullback troops from areas in Ukraine’s Kharkiv
49.article_body: Russia's Defense Ministry on Saturday announced it will pull back troops from areas in east Ukraine's Kharkiv region, where a Kyiv-based counteroffensive has made significant progress. Earlier, Ukrainian officials claimed their troops had cut off vital supplies of the Russians to the region. Russian Defense Ministry Spokesman Igor Konashenkov said troops would be regrouped in the Donetsk region.

50.title: Risky for me to participate in National Games: Neeraj Chopra
50.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra said that it will be risky for him to participate in National Games, which will take place from September 27. He said, "I just recovered from a groin injury. There was a plan to go on a vacation...I won't be able to train...I’d like to start focusing on next year."

51.title: Virat Kohli is tremendous, I think he is more skilful than me: Sourav Ganguly
51.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said he thinks Virat Kohli is more skilful than him. He further said Kohli is tremendous. Ganguly added, "We played in different generations...and we played a lot of cricket. I played in my generation...and he'll continue playing, probably playing more games than I did. Currently...I've played more than what he has but he'll get past that."

52.title: Video shows heaps of cash during raid at Kolkata businessman's house, ₹17cr seized
52.article_body: Videos and pictures on Saturday showed heaps of cash found during a raid by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) at Kolkata-based businessman Nisar Ahmed Khan's house. RBI and SBI officials brought at least eight cash counting machines to Khan's residence and at least ₹17 crores in cash were seized over several hours. The raid was conducted over mobile gaming application fraud.

53.title: As population ages, hip fractures will double worldwide by 2050: Study
53.article_body: Osteoporotic or hip fracture, which generally affects elderly people globally, might double by 2050 as the population ages, a study stated. Researchers gathered information from 19 nations for patients aged 50 and above who suffered hip fractures between 2005 and 2018 and found that in 18 of these countries, an overall rise in hip fracture cases was anticipated over time.

54.title: Don't cross lines: Mahua on BJP criticising Rahul's ₹41,000 t-shirt
54.article_body: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra said the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) was 'crossing the lines' by commenting on the Opposition members' personal belongings. The BJP had earlier attacked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, saying he was wearing a ₹41,257 t-shirt while speaking on inflation. "Remember if we start doing the same...you'll rue the day you started this game," Moitra said.

55.title: 6 undertrial prisoners escape from jail in Meghalaya
55.article_body: Six undertrial prisoners escaped from a jail in Meghalaya's West Jaintia Hills district on Saturday at around 2 am, Inspector General of Prisons Jerry FK Marak said. The escapees attacked and overpowered the prison guards, the top official added. A murder accused is among those who broke out of the prison, news agency PTI reported.

56.title: A month after opening, Taliban close girls schools in Afghanistan
56.article_body: Taliban authorities on Saturday closed girls schools (above sixth grade) in Afghanistan’s Paktia province, the Associated Press news agency reported quoting witnesses. Earlier this month, four girls schools in the province's capital, Gardez, and one in Samkani district began operating without permission from the Taliban Education Ministry. All these newly opened schools were closed on Saturday.

57.title: A huge project that has got all larger-than-life elements: Disha on Suriya 42
57.article_body: Actress Disha Patani, speaking about her upcoming film with Suriya, said that it is a "huge project that has got all the larger-than-life elements for the audience to experience on the big screen". She added that she's excited to bring her "never seen before avatar" to the audience. Tentatively titled 'Suriya 42', the film will be directed by Siva.

58.title: Big Foe you didn't let anyone down: Blake after Tiafoe's US Open semis loss
58.article_body: After American Frances Tiafoe lost in his first-ever Grand Slam semi-final at US Open 2022, James Blake tweeted, "Big Foe...you didn't let anyone down. In fact, just the opposite. You lifted so many with your play and your heart. Many more chances." Chris Evert took to Twitter and wrote, "You made us Proud...and you'll win the US Open one day."

59.title: Andhra Pradesh govt to revive Marriage Financial Assistance scheme
59.article_body: The government of Andhra Pradesh has decided to revive the Marriage Financial Assistance scheme for backward classes, minorities, and the differently-abled in the state. The scheme will be launched with a new name and an enhanced scale of benefit, PTI reported. The YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led government in 2019 had stopped the scheme implemented by former CM Chandrababu Naidu's government.

60.title: Ranveer Singh breaks down while accepting Filmfare award, shares video
60.article_body: Ranveer Singh took to Instagram to share a video of himself receiving Best Actor award at the 67th Filmfare Awards. In the video, he can be seen breaking down while giving the acceptance speech. "Most of the time...I can't even believe that I am here...doing this...I am in disbelieve everyday that I became an actor. It's a miracle," he said.

61.title: Great to play against you and with you as well at RCB: Kohli on Finch's ODI retirement
61.article_body: After Australia white-ball captain Aaron Finch announced his retirement from ODI cricket, Virat Kohli commented on the player's retirement post, writing, "Well done Finchy." He added, "It was great to play against you all these years and with you as well at rcb. Enjoy the next phase of your life to the fullest."

62.title: Aaron Finch shares pics after his ODI retirement, says 'It's been one hell of a ride'
62.article_body: After announcing his ODI retirement, Australia's Aaron Finch took to Instagram to share pictures and pen a note. He wrote, "It's been one hell of a ride...To play with and against some of the greatest players of all time has been a privilege." He added, "Representing Australia was my dream as a kid...Thanks so much for all of the...well wishes!"

63.title: Don't harass persons summoned for enquiry: HC to Tamil Nadu Police
63.article_body: The Madras High Court on Thursday directed the Tamil Nadu Police to not harass persons summoned for enquiry at police stations. Police should summon a witness or an accused in any case through a written summon, it added. The court observed that power to enquire must be exercised within the framework of Chapter XII of the Code of Criminal Procedure.

64.title: Queen's funeral to be held on Monday, she'll Lie-in-State for 4 days: Royal Family
64.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's funeral will be held on September 19 (Monday) at London's Westminster Abbey, Britain's Royal Family announced on Saturday. It'll be held at 1100 hours BST (3.30 pm IST). "Prior to the State Funeral, The Queen will Lie-in-State in Westminster Hall for four days, to allow the public to pay their respects," said the Royals in a statement.

65.title: Overwhelmed by the amazing response to my 'Brahmastra' character: Mouni
65.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy, speaking about her latest movie 'Brahmastra', said that she's "truly overwhelmed" by the "amazing response" the film and her character has been receiving. "I had dedicated myself thoroughly for my role Junoon and I am glad the patience has paid off," she added. The Ayan Mukerji directorial reportedly collected ₹35-36 crore in India on the first day.

66.title: Congrats to this bloke, 17 tons in only 145 ODIs: Maxwell on Finch's ODI retirement
66.article_body: Reacting to the announcement of Australia ODI captain Aaron Finch's retirement from ODI cricket, teammate Glenn Maxwell wrote on Instagram, "Congrats to this bloke on an amazing ODI career!!" He added, "17 tons in only 145 games, WC [World Cup] winner, captained for over a third of your career...countless blow ups with me, 1,36,000 bubbles blown while batting. Enjoy retirement."

67.title: Reply to pleas on convicts' remission in Bilkis case: SC to Gujarat
67.article_body: The Supreme Court has asked the Gujarat government to file its response to petitions challenging the remission of sentence granted to 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case from the 2002 Gujarat riots. The SC also asked the convicts to file their response. On August 15, the Gujarat government had released the 11 convicts under its remission policy.

68.title: King Charles III proclaimed Canada's new head of state
68.article_body: King Charles III was proclaimed the new monarch of Canada in a formal ceremony in Ottawa on Saturday. The ceremony took place at the official residence of Canada's Governor General. Charles III automatically became the king of the United Kingdom (UK) and 14 other Commonwealth realms, including Canada, upon the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II, on Thursday.

69.title: Andhra woman wades through river to appear for exam; video surfaces
69.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a 21-year-old student in Andhra Pradesh's Vizianagaram district wading through a river to appear for an examination. As per reports, the river was in spate due to heavy rains upstream, which cut off the village. Her brother and another family member carried her on their shoulders as she reportedly didn't know how to swim.

70.title: Can't afford to make so many changes: RP Singh on India's Asia Cup performance
70.article_body: Commenting on India's performance in Asia Cup 2022, RP Singh said, "You can't afford to make so many changes in...Indian team." He added, "You need to understand that the insecurity among the players increases and it disturbs...balance of the team." Defending champions India couldn't qualify for the final after losing two out of three matches in the Super 4 stage.

71.title: Climate change is affecting drinking water quality: Study
71.article_body: Researchers studied the Rappbode reservoir, Germany's largest drinking water reservoir, and found that climate-related disappearance of forests can affect water quality. As per researchers, forests filter the water and bind nutrients and are, therefore, necessary for good water quality. They also warned that the problem of such indirect consequences of climate change is seriously underestimated.

72.title: 20 died across Maharashtra during Ganesh idol immersions: Police
72.article_body: At least 20 persons died in accidents during the immersion of Ganesh idols across Maharashtra this year, police said on Saturday. In total, 14 people drowned in separate incidents in Wardha, Yavatmal, Ahmednagar, Jalgaon, Pune, Satara and Solapur districts. The 10-day Ganesh Chaturthi festival started on August 31 and ended on Friday.

73.title: Sharad Pawar unanimously re-elected as NCP President for 4 years
73.article_body: Sharad Pawar has been unanimously re-elected as the President of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), party spokesperson Mahesh Bharat Tapase said on Saturday. The 81-year-old leader will be NCP President for another four years. The decision was announced at the party's national executive meeting, which was attended by MLA Ajit Pawar, MP Praful Patel, MP Supriya Sule and others.

74.title: Newly-engaged couple on way to see Taj Mahal dies in road accident
74.article_body: A newly-engaged couple was killed in a road accident on Yamuna Expressway while travelling to visit the Taj Mahal, police said on Saturday. The car in which the couple was travelling, hit another vehicle from behind, police added. According to police, the couple succumbed at the spot. The accident occurred at around Friday midnight, Additional SP (Rural) Mathura said.

75.title: We're now just one step away from our goal of winning Asia Cup trophy: Babar
75.article_body: Ahead of Sri Lanka-Pakistan final in Asia Cup 2022, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said his side has seen some great performances and different players have shone in the tournament. "We're now just one step away from our goal of winning the trophy...As a team, our goal is to perform well," he added. Final will be played in Dubai on Sunday.

76.title: India should be united, not divided to move ahead: Anurag Thakur
76.article_body: Union minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday said India should be united and not divided to move ahead. Speaking at a programme on Himachal Pradesh's formation day, Thakur said, "We're celebrating 75 years of Independence as 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'." "Our PM has shown the right direction for India [for] the next 25 years...this Independence Day," he added.

77.title: The problem in India is that everyone wants a gold medal: Neeraj Chopra
77.article_body: Reacting to some people saying he should have won gold medal instead of silver at World Championships, Indian javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra said, "This is the problem in India. That everyone wants a gold medal." He added, "It's very important to know that in this sport, it isn't possible to get a gold medal [every time]."

78.title: He's the only actor to succeed in all genres: Sunny on father Dharmendra
78.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol said in an interview that his father, veteran actor Dharmendra Deol, is "the only actor to succeed in all genres". He added his father never shied away from exploring different roles. "Be it Satyakam, Chupke Chupke, Sholay, Pratigya, Phool Aur Patthar...he has done it all. I wish I was an active actor in his era," said Sunny.

79.title: Cost to rebuild war-hit Ukraine reaches $349 billion: Report
79.article_body: The cost to rebuild Ukraine and its economy after the Russian war has reached $349 billion, stated a report by the European Commission, the World Bank and the Ukrainian government. It presents estimates up to June 1, not accounting for the damage thereafter. Direct damage is estimated at $97 billion and disruption to economic flows is estimated at $252 billion.

80.title: Child steals ₹10 lakh from UP bank within 7 seconds; video emerges
80.article_body: A child stole ₹10 lakh in broad daylight from the cash counter of a district cooperative bank within seven seconds in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura on Thursday. A CCTV footage showed the minor boy putting two bundles of cash into his bag while the cashier was not present at the counter. Police are currently looking for the boy.

81.title: BJP opposes dynasty politics democratically: Assam CM Himanta Sarma
81.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday criticised dynasty politics and said the country should be free of such politics. "This is the issue in Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and also Telangana, where dynasty politics is going on," Sarma said. "BJP opposes that democratically. A democratic party should replace 'family raj'," Sarma added.

82.title: 330 kg of stolen railway scrap seized in WB's Baruipur, 4 arrested
82.article_body: Police on Saturday arrested four persons and seized 330 kg of railway scrap being stolen by them from Beniadanga Railway workshop in West Bengal's Baruipur, an official said. A police team led by Sub-Inspector Sukumar Rabidas during patrol duty in the early hours of Saturday intercepted the four persons, the official said, adding that a case has been registered.

83.title: Neha meets old friend during Indian Idol 13 auditions, refuses to judge him
83.article_body: A promo for the singing reality show 'Indian Idol 13' showed singer-judge Neha Kakkar meeting her old friend Vineet Singh during the audition round. She, however, refused to judge him. "Vineet had gone on a show where he emerged as the star. So I can't judge [him]," she said. Vineet eventually convinced Neha to judge him.

84.title: Maha man stopped from shooting video at police post bites policeman
84.article_body: An offence has been registered against a man for allegedly biting a policeman who stopped him from shooting a video of on-duty personnel at a police post in Maharashtra's Nagpur, an officer said on Saturday. The 30-year-old accused had argued with police officers for not registering a case against a man with whom he had a dispute, the officer added.

85.title: 17 Chinese aircraft crossed Taiwan Strait median line, says Taipei
85.article_body: As many as 17 Chinese aircraft crossed the median line of the Taiwan Strait on Saturday, as per Taiwan's Defence Ministry. China has stepped up military activity around Taiwan since US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taipei visit last month. Earlier this month, in a first-of-its-kind incident, Taiwanese military shot down a Chinese drone in Taiwan's airspace.

86.title: BBC auto-captions mishear 'Regina' as 'vagina' during news report on Queen's death
86.article_body: During the news coverage of the events linked to Queen Elizabeth II's demise, BBC News auto-subtitles misheard the anchor and flashed the word "vagina" instead of "Regina". A viewer shared a picture of the mistake on Twitter, saying, "Oops.. BBC should really be more careful with their auto subtitles." BBC was explaining how King Charles' wife Camilla wasn't 'Queen Regina'.

87.title: 2 dead, 2 missing after snake boat capsizes in river in Kerala
87.article_body: Two persons died and two others went missing on Saturday after a palliyodam (snake boat) capsized in the Achankovil river in Kerala's Chennithala, police said. The incident took place when the victims were preparing to participate in the Aranmula Boat Race on Sunday. A senior police officer said that there were around 60 people on the boat.

88.title: Centre refused to share funds for farmers to stop stubble burning: Punjab CM
88.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday said the Centre has turned down the proposal of the AAP-led governments in Punjab and Delhi to give cash incentives to farmers for not burning stubble during the upcoming kharif harvest. "It does not matter. If the central government is not supporting, then it does not mean we will not do anything," Mann added.

89.title: King Charles places gift from William & Harry on desk as he's officially declared monarch
89.article_body: King Charles signed the declaration which officially made him the new British monarch using ink from a pot gifted to him by his sons, Prince William and Prince Harry. He was declared monarch at a meeting of the Accession Council. During the meeting, which was televised for the first time in history, King Charles signed two copies of the declaration.

90.title: Afridi reveals his daughter waved Indian flag at Asia Cup match due to lack of Pak flags
90.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi revealed his daughter waved Indian flag during the Asia Cup 2022 match between the teams due to lack of Pakistani flags at the Dubai stadium. "My wife told me the crowd comprised just 10% Pakistanis and 90% Indians," he added. "I received the video...I was unsure about whether to share it online or not," Afridi said.

91.title: This is one of the best Asia Cups we've had: SL skipper Shanaka ahead of final
91.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said his side is looking forward to playing in Asia Cup 2022 final against a "very good" Pakistan team. "As a tournament, looking back, this has been one of the best Asia Cups we have had," he added. Sri Lanka won all three matches in the Super 4 stage. Final will be played on Sunday.

92.title: Selectors might tilt towards favouring Kohli for opening spot: Reetinder
92.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi said Virat Kohli's maiden T20I century against Afghanistan in Asia Cup 2022 might tilt the selectors and team management towards favouring the India batter for the opening position alongside Rohit Sharma. "He [Kohli] also has the ability to hit good balls for boundaries," he added. Kohli, who opened alongside KL Rahul against Afghanistan, scored 122*(61).

93.title: I don't even know who she is: Pakistan's Naseem Shah on Urvashi over viral video
93.article_body: After an edited video of him and actress Urvashi Rautela from Asia Cup 2022 went viral on social media, Pakistan's 19-year-old fast bowler Naseem Shah said, "I don't even know who Urvashi is." He added, "I have no idea why do people make and share such videos." He further said that he has no plans of entering into showbiz.

94.title: Bihar policemen allegedly kept inside lockup by senior: Report
94.article_body: Five policemen were reportedly kept inside a lockup for two hours over the alleged orders of Superintendent of Police Gaurav Mangala in Bihar's Nawada. The SP was reportedly dissatisfied with the performance of the three assistant sub-inspectors and two sub-inspectors. The Bihar Police Association has sought a judicial probe into the matter.

95.title: I enjoy anchoring with my husband, there's no competition: Bharti
95.article_body: Bharti Singh said in an interview that many people have issues with her anchoring. "[They]...feel that I try to steal somebody else's thunder by cracking such jokes that the focus and attention stay on me," she added. Bharti further said this is also the reason she enjoys anchoring with her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa because there's "no competition or any awkwardness".

96.title: Iran hurting chances of nuclear deal revival: France, Germany & UK
96.article_body: France, Germany, and the UK on Saturday criticised Iran for demanding the closure of an ongoing probe by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) as a guarantee for a "sustainable" revival of the 2015 nuclear deal. "This latest demand raises serious doubts as to Iran's intentions and commitment" and "jeopardises" prospects of restoring the deal, the three countries said.

97.title: Archaeologist BB Lal passes away at the age of 101; PM pays tribute
97.article_body: Archaeologist and Padma Vibhushan awardee Braj Basi Lal died at the age of 101 on Saturday. Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to Lal and said, "His contributions to culture and archaeology are unparalleled." Lal, former Director General of Archaeological Survey of India, had reportedly found temple-like pillars at the Ayodhya site where the Ram temple is now being built.

98.title: SP losing support base in UP, its own action is the reason: Mayawati
98.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday criticised Samajwadi Party saying it is losing its support base in Uttar Pradesh and its own action is the main reason. "When there's news in the media about their mutual quarrels and tussles within the family, party...and about their open nexus with criminal elements...then why should there be no disappointment among the people," Mayawati tweeted.

99.title: Won't give up right to self-defence: Kim Jong-un on denuclearisation
99.article_body: North Korea's Supreme Leader Kim Jong-un on Thursday said that the US wants to weaken his country's "rights to self-defence" through its denuclearisation, North Korean state media reported. "We will never give up our rights...to temporarily ease the difficulties we are experiencing now," Kim added. North Korea recently passed a law allowing it to launch a pre-emptive nuclear strike.

100.title: Haasan's 'Vikram' completes 100 days in theatres, actor shares post
100.article_body: Kamal Haasan took to Twitter on Saturday to share a post marking 100 days since the release of 'Vikram'. In an audio message, Haasan said, "With...support accorded by fans, 'Vikram' has now touched the 100-day mark in theatres...In my heart, I hug...every one of you who've been admiring me beyond generations." The film also starred Fahadh Faasil and Vijay Sethupathi.

101.title: 27-yr-old Naxalite carrying ₹10 lakh reward surrenders in Chhattisgarh
101.article_body: A 27-year-old Naxalite, Lallu Modiyan, carrying a reward of ₹10 lakh surrendered before the police in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Saturday, an official said. Modiyan was a member of the Jharkhand Regional Committee. Modiyan had joined the Naxal movement in June 2009 and was tasked with sending messages and keeping a watch on the police, the official said.

102.title: Fraudsters cheat Serum Institute of ₹1 crore by asking for money transfer in CEO's name
102.article_body: Fraudsters cheated vaccine-maker Serum Institute of India (SII) of over ₹1 crore by sending messages on WhatsApp in the name of its CEO Adar Poonawalla and asking for transfer of money, Pune Police said. Believing that the messages were sent by Adar, company officials transferred the amount and later realised that he had not sent any such WhatsApp communication.

103.title: Boy tied to tree & beaten by priest for stealing almonds in MP, FIR filed
103.article_body: An 11-year-old boy was allegedly tied to a tree and beaten up by a priest at a Jain temple in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district for stealing almonds offered to God, police said on Saturday. A case has been registered based on a complaint lodged by the boy's father. In a video, he is purportedly seen crying and asking for help.

104.title: PM Modi calls UK PM Liz Truss to express condolences over Queen's demise
104.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday spoke with the new British PM Liz Truss on phone, to congratulate her on assuming the country's top office and to condole Queen Elizabeth II's demise, the government said. "On behalf of the people of India, PM Modi conveyed deep condolences to the Royal family and the people of the UK," said a government release.

105.title: American player Tiafoe breaks down on live TV after losing US Open semi, video viral
105.article_body: American tennis player Frances Tiafoe broke down on live TV after losing the US Open 2022 men's singles semi-final against Spain's Carlos Alcaraz. Tiafoe broke down while being interviewed on court after his loss. "This one really really hurts," he said. "I'm going to come back and I will win this thing one day. I am sorry, guys," he added.

106.title: Bopanna pulls out of India's Davis Cup tie vs Norway due to injury
106.article_body: Doubles tennis player Rohan Bopanna has withdrawn from India's Davis Cup 2022 World Group I tie against Norway due to knee inflammation. The tie will be held on September 16 and 17 in Lillehammer, Norway. "I have an inflammation on my knee and have been advised to rest it before I start competing again," tweeted Bopanna.

107.title: Theatres open early morning, late night shows of 'Brahmāstra' amid huge demand
107.article_body: With many shows of 'Brahmāstra' going houseful, theatres in many major centres have opened early morning and late night shows to keep up with increased demand. On Saturday, some people tweeted screenshots of theatres in Delhi opening shows as early as 6 am for IMAX version. New shows mean the film will run in some screens for almost 21 hours.

108.title: Argentine TV anchor celebrates Queen's death by drinking champagne, criticised
108.article_body: An Argentinian TV presenter was criticised for celebrating Queen Elizabeth II's death by drinking champagne live on air. A video of the broadcast showed Santiago Cúneo pouring himself a drink while the message "The old bag of s*** has died" flashed on the screen. "I'm Argentinian...this guy doesn't represent me," said a Twitter user, while another called him a "disgrace".

109.title: Australia's Warner, Stoinis ruled out of 3rd ODI against New Zealand
109.article_body: Australia all-rounder Marcus Stoinis has been ruled out of the team's third and final ODI against New Zealand due to a side strain, while opener David Warner was released from the squad to rest. There is no injury concern for Warner. The third ODI will be played on Sunday. Australia lead the three-match ODI series 2-0.

110.title: House collapses into river after cloudburst in U'khand; video surfaces
110.article_body: A woman died and nearly 50 houses were left submerged in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh after a cloudburst was reported near the Dharchula town, officials said. In a video shared by Uttarakhand Police's Fire Service, a house is seen collapsing into the Kali river. Pithoragarh DM Ashish Kumar Chauhan said 170 affected people of Khotila village have been evacuated.

111.title: 40% of electric vehicles in Delhi bought after 2020 policy: Govt
111.article_body: The sale of electric vehicles (EVs) in Delhi increased after the implementation of the 2020 Electric Vehicles Policy, with 40% of all vehicles being bought after the policy came into effect. According to official data till August 31 this year, Delhi has over 1.64 lakh electric vehicles. Of these, 67,063 vehicles were purchased after the policy's implementation.

112.title: 19-yr-old Hyd woman killed by man for rejecting his marriage proposal
112.article_body: A 19-year-old woman from Hyderabad was allegedly killed by a man for rejecting his marriage proposal in Telangana's Wanaparthy. On August 5, the accused asked the woman to visit his village. When she reached there, he asked her to marry him, but she refused, leading to an argument between them. Following this, he reportedly strangled her with her dupatta.

113.title: Haryana Police arrest man for committing ATM fraud in 3 states
113.article_body: The Haryana Police on Saturday said they arrested a man, Rohit alias Amit, who was allegedly involved in ATM fraud cases in Haryana, Himachal Pradesh and Rajasthan. Amit used to fraudulently obtain automated teller machine (ATM) cards from unknown people and clone them. Later, on the pretext of helping them, he used to get passwords and siphon money, police said.

114.title: 'Dhokha: Round D Corner' was completed in just 29 days: Director Kookie
114.article_body: Director Kookie Gulati revealed that he completed the shoot of his upcoming film, 'Dhokha: Round D Corner', in 29 days. "We kept a target to finish...in 44 days but with...proficiency of R Madhavan, Khushali (Kumar), Darshan (Kumaar) and Aparshakti (Khurana), we were able to complete [it] in just 29 days," he said. The film will be released on September 23.

115.title: My mind is blown, Rajamouli is a genius: Jennifer Beals on RRR
115.article_body: American actress Jennifer Beals, known for films like 'Flashdance' and 'The Book of Eli', on Friday tweeted, "I just watched the epic RRR in a theatre and my mind is BLOWN." Calling the film's director SS Rajamouli a "genius", she added, "Leaving the theatre, I wanted to work out, dance and meditate-all at once. Long live the revolutionaries!"

116.title: Shah lays foundation stone of border tourism development work in Rajasthan
116.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday laid the foundation stone of border tourism development work at India-Pakistan border in Rajasthan, around 120 kilometres from Jaisalmer. He laid the foundation stone of the project as part of his two-day visit to Rajasthan. "For the first time...development is reaching the border areas under the leadership of (PM) Modi ji," Shah said.

117.title: Rahul Gandhi needs to study history first: Amit Shah on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
117.article_body: Taking a swipe at Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Rahul Gandhi needs to study the country's history first. "[In] his speech given in Parliament, Rahul...said India is not a nation at all...in which book have you read this?" Shah said. "This is the nation for which lakhs...of people have sacrificed their lives," he added.

118.title: No metro services between Qutab Minar, Sultanpur on Sunday morning
118.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has announced that train services will not be available from Sultanpur to Qutab Minar on the Yellow Line for going towards Samaypur Badli from 5:15 am to 6:00 am on Sunday. The services are being suspended due to maintenance work. However, trains will be available from Qutab Minar for going towards Samaypur Badli.

119.title: Home registration in Hyd region see 36% yr-on-yr decline in Aug: Report
119.article_body: Registration of residential properties in the Hyderabad region fell 36% year-on-year (YoY) to 5,181 units in August 2022, as per Knight Frank India. In August 2021, 8,144 housing units were registered in the Hyderabad residential market that includes four districts — Hyderabad, Medchal-Malkajgiri, Rangareddy and Sangareddy. The value of properties transacted in August 2022 was ₹2,657.8 crore.

120.title: Virat Kohli shares childhood pic, says 'Eat, drink and enjoy'
120.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli took to his Instagram Stories to share a childhood picture of himself, wherein he can be seen eating. "Khao piyo aish karo mitro...Dil par kise da dukhayo na (Eat, drink and enjoy, friends...but don't hurt anyone's feelings)," he wrote in the caption, using lyrics from the 2001 Punjabi song 'Aish Karo'.

121.title: Indian Sikh brother reunites with Pakistani Muslim sister 75 years after Partition
121.article_body: Jalandhar-based Sikh man Amarjit Singh met his Muslim sister Kulsoom Akhtar from Pakistan at Gurdwara Darbar Sahib in Kartarpur, 75 years after he was separated from his family at the time of Partition. Talking to Pakistan's Express Tribune, Kulsoom said her parents migrated to Pakistan from a suburb in Jalandhar in 1947, leaving behind her brother and a sister.

122.title: Pools in Hockey WC are always difficult: Indian men's team head coach Reid
122.article_body: After India were drawn in Pool D with England, Spain and Wales in Hockey World Cup 2023, Indian men's hockey team head coach Graham Reid said World Cup and Olympics pools are always difficult. "Every team is there to win. We just played England and Wales in...Birmingham 2022 Commonwealth Games and the games were of the highest quality," he added.

123.title: 173 lumpy skin disease cases reported in Delhi: Minister Gopal Rai
123.article_body: Delhi has so far recorded 173 cases of lumpy skin disease with most cases reported in the city's south and west, Minister for Environment Gopal Rai said. Most cases have been reported from the Goyla Dairy area (45 cows) and Rewla Khanpur (40 cows). The symptoms include nodules on the cow's skin, fever, watery eyes and weight loss.

124.title: Nearly half of the dengue cases in 2022 were reported in Aug: PMC
124.article_body: Nearly half of the suspected dengue fever cases reported this year under the Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) limits were recorded in August. According to the PMC's data, 2,621 suspected cases of dengue were reported till September 3. "At least 1,062 suspected cases of dengue viral fever were detected in August itself," said Assistant Health Chief, PMC, Dr Sanjeev Wavare.

125.title: Last of Moosewala's 6 shooters, his 2 aides arrested near Bengal-Nepal border
125.article_body: Punjab Police said the last of the six shooters involved in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, Deepak Mundi, was arrested on Saturday from near the West Bengal-Nepal border, along with two of his associates. "Deepak was the shooter in Bolero module, [while] Kapil Pandit and Rajinder provided logistical support, including weapons and hideouts," Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav said.

126.title: US sanctions Iran's Intelligence Ministry over cyberattack on Albania
126.article_body: The US Treasury Department on Friday imposed new sanctions on Iran's Ministry of Intelligence for its alleged involvement in a cyberattack against NATO member and US ally Albania in July. The move came after Albania severed diplomatic ties with Iran and ordered the expulsion of Iranian diplomats and embassy staff on Wednesday over the incident.

127.title: 96 samples of sweet, snacks, ghee & edible oil collected in Mumbai
127.article_body: As part of a drive initiated before the beginning of Ganeshotsav, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in Mumbai collected 96 samples of sweets, snacks, ghee and edible oil sold in markets. As many as 51 samples of sweets, six samples of snacks and seven samples of edible oil were sent for quality check purposes, an FDA official informed.

128.title: His real face is anti-Hindu: Sambit Patra on Rahul Gandhi's video with pastor
128.article_body: Reacting to a video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi with Tamil pastor George Ponnaiah, BJP leader Sambit Patra said it's not the first time Rahul has made indecent remarks against Hinduism. He said Rahul visits temples during elections to create a farce. "When elections conclude, this farce of Rahul...ends and his real...anti-Hindu face...comes to light," he added.

129.title: No music allowed in dressing room for India Women's T20I as England mourns Queen's death
129.article_body: Players will not be allowed to play music in the dressing room during India Women-England Women's first T20I at the Riverside Ground in Chester-le-Street. This comes as England is mourning the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. Further, there will be no commercial activity allowed inside the stadium, reports said. The country's flags at the venue will also be at half-mast.

130.title: Police seize 860 kg marijuana from Assam's Karbi Anglong, 3 held
130.article_body: The Assam Police and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) seized 860 kg of marijuana and 40.70 grams of suspected heroin from a truck in Karbi Anglong district on Saturday. Three persons have been arrested in the case. The truck was coming from Manipur and the drugs were hidden inside a secret chamber of the truck's body, a police official said.

131.title: What does 'EIIR', seen on the throne during King Charles' accession ceremony, mean?
131.article_body: The symbol 'EIIR' was seen on the throne of the British monarch during King Charles III's accession ceremony in St James' Palace on Saturday. It is the late Queen Elizabeth II's royal cypher and stands for Elizabeth II Regina, as 'Regina' means queen in Latin. The cypher is likely to change to 'CIIIR' to represent King Charles, reports said.

132.title: The film student in me needs to watch Brahmastra again: Hrithik
132.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter on Saturday to praise Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra', saying, "The film student in me needs to watch Brahmastra again." "The action, the grading, the BGM, the VFX, the sound design uff...Absolutely incredible work!! Too good," he wrote, adding, "Thoroughly enjoyed this one." The film reportedly collected ₹35-36 crore at the domestic box office on Friday.

133.title: Bomb explodes in front of RSS worker's residence in Kerala
133.article_body: A bomb exploded in front of a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker's house in Kannur, Kerala, on Thursday night. According to Mattannur Police, the bomb exploded about 50 metres away from the house of RSS worker Sudheesh. Police have registered a case under the Explosives Act. Notably, police said that Sudheesh is also accused in many cases.

134.title: Pune admin to acquire 6,000-hectare land for Purandar airport
134.article_body: The Pune district administration said it will require 6,000 hectares of land for the Purandar Airport and logistics park. This followed Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's announcement that the airfield will be constructed along with a logistics park. As per the initial proposal, the airport would require 2,832-hectare land. The proposed logistical park will require additional 3,103-hectare land.

135.title: Suriya's next pan-India 3D film to release in 10 languages
135.article_body: Actor Suriya's next film, tentatively titled 'Suriya 42', will be shot in 3D and be released in 10 languages. Disha Patani has been roped in to play the female lead in the upcoming film. It will be directed by Siva. The motion poster of the film was launched on Friday. Suriya was recently seen in Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram'.

136.title: Man shot at in Mumbai's Bandra by unidentified assailant
136.article_body: A man was shot by an unidentified assailant in Mumbai's Bandra East area on Thursday, a police official told PTI on Friday. The bullet fired by the assailant hit the victim on his back, the official added. The official further informed that the victim is undergoing treatment at a hospital. "An attempt to murder case has been registered," he stated.

137.title: 11 suffer electric shock during Ganesh idol immersion in Panvel
137.article_body:
At least 11 persons in Panvel suffered an electric shock after a wire from the generator machine snapped during Ganesh idol immersion. "One is in the ICU, while two of those affected are small children aged five and 15," Panvel Municipal Corporation Commissioner Ganesh Deshmukh said. 
Deshmukh added that the police were yet to determine why the wire snapped.

138.title: Will stand with Ukraine for as long as it is necessary: Germany
138.article_body: Germany's support for Ukraine wouldn't falter in the face of reduced Russian energy supplies, German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said as she arrived in Kyiv. "We'll stand by Ukraine for as long as necessary," Baerbock said, adding that German support would include arms and financial aid. It's Baerbock's second visit to Kyiv since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

139.title: I'll win this thing: American Tiafoe after losing in US Open semis
139.article_body: Following his loss in the US Open semi-final, US' Frances Tiafoe said, "I gave everything I had these past two weeks...This one really, really hurts." He added, "I'm going to come back and I'll win this [US Open] thing one day." Tiafoe lost to Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(8-6), 3-6, 1-6, 7-6(7-5), 3-6. Both were playing in their maiden Grand Slam semi-final.

140.title: PM Modi proud of his heritage, unlike Nehru: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
140.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday said unlike former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru, PM Narendra Modi is "proud" of the country's heritage. "There was one Prime Minister who didn't feel proud of his heritage, and then there's Narendra Modi, who has resolved to make the whole India, 'Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat', by connecting with his heritage," he said.

141.title: 25-yr-old man booked for raping Class 2 student in UP's Ballia
141.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been booked for allegedly raping a Class 2 student in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia. The accused reportedly lured the seven-year-old girl when she was playing outside and took her to his house on a motorcycle, where he raped her, police said. A case was registered after the girl's father filed a police complaint.

142.title: 'The Lion King' prequel announced, film to release in 2024
142.article_body: A prequel to the 2019 film 'The Lion King' was announced on Friday. Titled 'Mufasa: The Lion King', the upcoming film will release in 2024. Oscar-winning director Barry Jenkins, who's set to helm the project, said it is a "story about how Mufasa rose to royalty". The film will also feature the younger versions of characters Timon, Pumbaa and Rafiki.

143.title: Don’t have a plan that requires people to return to office: Amazon CEO
143.article_body: Amazon doesn't have plans to ask its corporate employees to return to office with CEO Andy Jassy saying, "We don't right now. But we're going to proceed adaptively as we learn." During the COVID-19 pandemic, Amazon had announced in October 2021 that it would leave it up to individual managers to decide when workers needed to come to office.

144.title: 'Secularism experts' now decide who's secular, who's communal: Owaisi
144.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday criticised Opposition parties for posing as "experts of secularism". "When we speak of the development of minority communities...nonsense is spoken against us. This is hypocrisy in a way that those posing as experts of secularism today will decide who's secular and who's communal," Owaisi said while addressing a press conference in Ahmedabad.

145.title: Area around Kartavya Path barricaded, visitors find difficult to find parking
145.article_body: Visitors found it difficult to find the four newly developed parking lots along Kartavya Path in Delhi. The area was barricaded, reports said, adding that one of the four parking lots was closed while the police said that parking lots were opened for the public. Security guards at parking located between C-hexagona and Man Singh Road only allowed government vehicles.

146.title: CCTV video shows dog biting food delivery man's private parts in Mumbai
146.article_body: A CCTV video, showing a pet dog biting a Zomato delivery man on his private parts inside a Mumbai building, has been widely shared online. The video was captured by a camera inside an elevator as the delivery person was exiting it on August 29. The man was reportedly hospitalised and the dog's owner paid his medical bills.

147.title: Forming 'khichdi govt' with weaker PM better than 'two-time PM': Owaisi
147.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has said that it will be better to form a "khichdi" government with a weaker PM than a "two-time PM" who complains about the system. "Those posing as experts of secularism today will decide who's secular and who's communal…BJP has 306 MPs, yet the PM complains about the system," Owaisi added.

148.title: ED raids Kolkata premises in fraud gaming app case; ₹7 cr seized so far
148.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday raided several premises in Kolkata in a fraud mobile gaming application case. The ED has seized ₹7 crore as of now. Cash counting machines have been brought by the ED as the counting of cash is ongoing. A man named Amir Khan, who had launched gaming application 'E-Nuggets', has been accused in the case.

149.title: Online gaming firm Roblox plans to launch 3D advertising next year
149.article_body: Online gaming firm Roblox Corporation said on Friday that it is planning to launch 3D advertising on its platform next year, adding that it will test ads with developers and some advertisers by this year-end. Better known as "immersive ads", the 3D advertising experience will be available to audiences aged only 13 and above, the California-based company said.

150.title: Will regularise temporary employees in states where AAP forms govt: Kejriwal
150.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal said his party will regularise temporary employees wherever it forms government. While lauding the AAP-led Punjab government for regularising 8,736 school teachers, Kejriwal urged all state governments to do the same. He further termed the contractual employment system "exploitative" and said only permanent employees should be there in the government.

151.title: Military base, road in Arunachal's Kibithu named after Bipin Rawat
151.article_body: A military station along the LAC in Arunachal Pradesh's Kibithu and a 22-kilometre-long stretch of road were named after former CDS General Bipin Rawat, who died in a helicopter crash last year. The station was named as Gen Bipin Rawat Military Garrison, while the road as Gen Bipin Rawat Marg. A life-size mural of Rawat was also unveiled, said officials.

152.title: Child-lifting rumours trigger mob attacks in UP, 35 booked in several incidents
152.article_body: Child-lifting rumours reportedly triggered widespread panic in parts of Uttar Pradesh. Reports said that several incidents of mob lynching and killing on suspicion of being a child-lifter increased following such rumours. An official said that so far 35 people were booked over several incidents that took place in the state. The police have said that these rumours are baseless.

153.title: US imposes sanctions on Iran over cyberattack on Albania
153.article_body: The US on Friday imposed sanctions on Iran's Intelligence Ministry and its minister in response to a July cyberattack that disrupted government websites in Albania and for engaging in other cyber activities against the US and its allies. On Wednesday, Albania severed diplomatic relations with Iran for the incident, ordering Iranian diplomats and embassy staff to leave within 24 hours.

154.title: 'Huge gap' in National Education Policy 2020: Manish Sisodia
154.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia expressed disappointment over the National Education Policy (NEP), 2020 and said that it cannot be implemented immediately as there is a "huge gap" in the scheme. "Changes are needed in NEP 2020...It is also the vision of Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal that education-related policies are given a 360-degree view," said Sisodia.

155.title: IIT Hyderabad releases statement after death of 2 students by suicide
155.article_body: IIT Hyderabad released a statement after the death of two of its students by suicide. In a statement, the institute said students feel pressure at the beginning of their projects, however, they're given time to grasp the requirements. On September 7, a former IIT Hyderabad student allegedly died by suicide and on August 31, an MTech student died by suicide.

156.title: 'Dog Officers' are ensuring Ganpati venues are safe: Pune police
156.article_body: The Pune City Police on Friday tweeted, "Our 'Dog Officers' Surya and Rana [are] ensuring all Ganpati venues and adjacent lanes are safe for us 'humans'!" The police also shared pictures of the same and said that the bomb detection and disposal teams are inspecting areas. The police added that all safety precautions are being taken amid the celebrations.

157.title: 1,108 kg ganja worth ₹2 crore seized near Assam-Tripura border, 1 held
157.article_body: Police seized 1,108 kg of ganja worth about ₹2 crore in Karimganj district along the Assam-Tripura border on Friday. One person has been arrested in the case. Police said that the ganja was seized from a truck coming from Tripura towards Guwahati. The ganja was recovered from a secret chamber in the truck.

158.title: Hopeful of at least two more trade deals by year-end: Piyush Goyal
158.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that India recently signed two trade agreements with the UAE and Australia. He also hopes to conclude the negotiations for two more such pacts by the year-end. Free trade agreement (FTA) negotiations with the UK are expected to be finalised this month, while talks with Canada for a deal are progressing well.

159.title: Typical BJP mischief: Congress on video of pastor telling Rahul 'Jesus is real God'
159.article_body: Congress has reacted to a video shared by the BJP, showing a pastor telling Rahul Gandhi, "Jesus is the real God." Congress communication in charge Jairam Ramesh called the video "typical BJP mischief", saying that BJP's tweet bore "no relation whatsoever to what is recorded in the audio". The video is from Rahul's meeting with Father George Ponnaiah.

160.title: My 2 properties in Goa have been grabbed: Indian-origin UK Home Secretary's father
160.article_body: Indian-origin UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman's father has complained that his two ancestral properties in North Goa have been grabbed by an unidentified person. Braverman was appointed as UK's new Home Secretary by Prime Minister Liz Truss earlier this week. The Special Investigation Team of the state police has filed a case and launched a probe, an official said.

161.title: 2 Hyderabad bank officials jailed for 5 years in cheating case
161.article_body: The Special Judge for CBI cases, Hyderabad, on Friday sentenced two officials of Indian Overseas Bank (IOB) to five years of rigorous imprisonment. In 2003, the then Chief Manager of IOB Hyderabad's main branch Souman Chakraborthy and his senior manager Sankaraman Padmanabhan had allegedly sanctioned 13 housing loans based on fake IT returns and fake title deeds as collateral security.

162.title: Differently-abled woman gang-raped in Maharashtra's Jalna, 3 arrested
162.article_body: A differently-abled woman was gang-raped by five men at a village in Maharashtra's Jalna district, police said on Saturday. The incident reportedly took place on August 28 and came to light earlier this week after the family members of the victim found out about the assault. Three of the five accused have been arrested, police added.

163.title: CCI dismisses JSW Paints' plea against Asian Paints alleging abuse of dominance
163.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) ruled in favour of Asian Paints and dismissed a complaint by JSW Paints alleging that the former blocked its entry into the decorative paints segment by abusing the market dominance. The probe found that Asian Paints' actions were "based on objective criteria and uniformly applicable practice of Asian Paints to protect its business interest".

164.title: Students protest over temple construction on B'luru university campus
164.article_body: Bangalore University (BU) students on Thursday protested against the construction of a Ganesha temple on the campus. They said University Grants Commission's guidelines forbade the building of religious structures in public-run institutions. Officials said a temple was earlier demolished on the campus for widening of a road, following which BU decided to shift the temple elsewhere on the campus.

165.title: UN chief Guterres visits areas of Pakistan devastated by floods
165.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, along with Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif, on Saturday visited several areas of Pakistan ravaged by floods as he rounded off a two-day trip to the country. "Pakistan needs massive financial support. This is not a matter of generosity, it's a matter of justice," Guterres said. Pakistan has put the cost of flood-related damage at $30 billion.

166.title: Adani's ₹31,000-cr open offer for ACC, Ambuja not fully subscribed
166.article_body: Adani Group's open offer for the acquisition of a 26% stake in Swiss firm Holcim's two Indian-listed entities, ACC Limited and Ambuja Cements, for ₹31,000 crore closed without being fully subscribed. As on Friday, 40.61 lakh shares of the 4.8 crore ACC shares were tendered. For Ambuja Cements, 7.2 lakh shares of the 51.6 crore shares were tendered.

167.title: Was dreaming of this moment: Alcaraz on reaching maiden Grand Slam final
167.article_body: After reaching his maiden Grand Slam final at US Open 2022, 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz said, "I thought about a young man like 10 years ago dreaming of this moment right now." Alcaraz beat Frances Tiafoe 6-7(6-8), 6-3, 6-1, 6-7(5-7), 6-3. He's the second teenager since American Pete Sampras in 1990 to enter the US Open final in the Open Era.

168.title: Man chops off tongue, offers it at Maa Sheetla temple in UP
168.article_body: A 38-year-old man chopped off his tongue using a blade at Maa Sheetla temple in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi district and offered it to the deity, said police on Saturday. The devotee, Sampat, has been admitted to the district hospital, where his condition is said to be serious. He was accompanied by his wife, Banno Devi, to the temple.

169.title: Delhi’s Bawana lake to be revamped as a picnic spot
169.article_body: Delhi government will build a park around Sanoth lake in the neighbourhood of Bawana and revamp it into a picnic spot. The park will have a children's playground, a picnic area, a walkway, a Chhath Puja ghat and a public outdoor gym. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has also directed the officials to make educational paintings on the lake's boundary wall.

170.title: Car rams into railing, falls off flyover in Punjab; 3 dead, 1 hurt
170.article_body: A woman, her mother-in-law and her son's friend died after a car they were travelling in rammed into the railing and then fell off the Ladhowal flyover in Punjab's Ludhiana on Friday. The woman's husband, who was also in the car, suffered severe injuries and is admitted to a hospital. The group was travelling to attend the son's marriage ritual.

171.title: ASI shoots himself dead inside police station in Punjab, records video blaming senior
171.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector named Satish Kumar shot himself dead with his service revolver inside Hariana police station in Punjab's Hoshiarpur after allegedly being humiliated by his senior. The 52-year-old recorded a video, wherein he blamed Tanda SHO Onkar Singh for his death. The SHO has been transferred to police line and a probe has been ordered, police said.

172.title: 55-yr-old pedestrian run over by police constable in Mumbai, held
172.article_body: A 55-year-old pedestrian, Vakil Salim Ansari, was killed after a car driven by a police constable ran over him in south Mumbai, police said on Saturday. The accused policeman was arrested on Friday and an offence was registered against him at Tardeo police station. The accident took place on Thursday night while Ansari was crossing the road, police said.

173.title: Lightning strikes road in Maha’s Nashik amid heavy rains, video surfaces
173.article_body: A video of lightning striking amid heavy rains in Maharashtra's Nashik has surfaced online. In the video, vehicles can be seen moving on the road. The video further shows lightning striking the road. Sparks can be seen blowing up behind the moving vehicles. Reports said that the incident took place in Nashik's JMCT College area.

174.title: Amit Shah lays foundation stone of Tanot Temple Complex in Rajasthan
174.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah laid the foundation stone of the Tanot Temple Complex Project, which is adjacent to the India-Pakistan international border and is around 120 km from Jaisalmer, Rajasthan.
