Over ₹17 crore has been approved by the Centre for the project. Centre is planning to make a waiting room, amphitheatre, room for children and other necessary facilities.

175.title: We should celebrate achievements of Indian scientists: PM Modi
175.article_body: After inaugurating the 'Centre-State Science Conclave' in Ahmedabad on Saturday, PM Narendra Modi said achievements of Indian scientists during the last century weren't "celebrated" adequately, as it should have been done. "Due to this...large part of our society remained indifferent to science," he said, adding, when we celebrate our scientists' achievements, science becomes part of our culture.

176.title: Over 2,100 cattle found infected with lumpy skin disease in 10 MP districts
176.article_body: 2,171 cattle have been found infected with the lumpy skin disease across 10 districts of Madhya Pradesh. Following this, the administration has banned the transportation of bovine animals in the affected parts of the state. State Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has directed officials to take extra precautions in the adjoining areas of the disease-affected districts.

177.title: 5 Hong Kong speech therapists jailed over 'seditious' children's books
177.article_body: Five Hong Kong speech therapists were jailed for 19 months for conspiracy to publish 'seditious' children's books. Prosecutors had deemed the books, which depicted sheep trying to defend their village from wolves, anti-government. Prosecutors said the animals were analogies for Hong Kong residents and mainland Chinese authorities respectively and were intended to incite hatred towards the latter.

178.title: Gal Gadot to play Evil Queen in 'Snow White' film
178.article_body: Actress Gal Gadot has been roped in to play Evil Queen in the upcoming live-action film 'Snow White'. The titular character will be played by 'West Side Story' star Rachel Zegler. Based on Disney's 'Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs', which was released in 1937, the upcoming project will be directed by Marc Webb. It will release in 2024.

179.title: Fadnavis criticises Maha Vikas Aghadi over beautification of Memon’s grave
179.article_body: Reacting to the controversy around beautification of Mumbai blasts convict Yakub Memon’s grave, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis criticised the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government. “We have seen who gives protection to convicts in Mumbai blast case. His companions who were made ministers are still in jail. We convicted the guilty of blasts by opening SC at night,” said Fadnavis.

180.title: Doesn't matter where you come from, here's to big dreams: Kriti on Filmfare win
180.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon, who won the Filmfare Best Actress award for 'Mimi', said in her acceptance speech that it doesn't matter where you come from or what your surname is. "It's taken me eight years, it might take you a little longer...but just believe in yourself...Never let anyone tell you your dream is too big...Here's to big dreams," she said.

181.title: Top seeds Ram-Salisbury win their 2nd straight men's doubles US Open title
181.article_body: Top seeds Rajeev Ram and Joe Salisbury beat second seeds Wesley Koolhof and Neal Skupski 7-6(7-4), 7-5 to win their second successive men's doubles title at US Open. With this, Ram and Salisbury have become the first men's team to defend their title at US Open since Australian duo of Todd Woodbridge and Mark Woodforde in 1996.

182.title: 14-year-old girl married off to 46-year-old man in K'taka; 3 arrested
182.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was married off to a 46-year-old man in Bengaluru. The girl's parents and husband, N Guruprasad, have been arrested on charges of child marriage, said police. Guruprasad is said to have convinced the girl's parents to marry their daughter to him for ₹15,000. The parents told the police that they agreed out of poverty.

183.title: Suggested use of skybuses in Bengaluru: Gadkari on improving mobility
183.article_body: Talking about improving road infrastructure and mobility in Bengaluru, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said that the Centre would study introducing skybuses and building flyovers. "We are working on public transport on electricity. Technology has changed a lot. It's difficult to acquire land in Bengaluru. So, I suggested the use of skybuses like in the Philippines and other countries," said Gadkari.

184.title: Kejriwal govt spent ₹168 cr for over 4 lakh patients since 2017: Sisodia
184.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal-led government has spent ₹168.43 crore to provide healthcare facilities to over 4.27 lakh patients in Delhi between 2017 and March 2022, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Friday. He also added that there are several schemes where the government provides financial support for patients' medical implants, surgeries, 136 types of medical tests and treatment of accident victims.

185.title: Congress wants to loot the poor people of Chhattisgarh: JP Nadda
185.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda criticised Congress and alleged that the party wants to loot the people of Chhattisgarh and fill the party’s treasury. "The Congress government in Chhattisgarh has stalled several ongoing development projects in the state. They never want development of the society. They want to become the Congress party’s ATM," said Nadda.

186.title: India’s Global Innovation Index ranking improved from 81 to 46: PM Modi
186.article_body: PM Narendra Modi hailed Centre’s science and technology-based development model and said that India’s Global Innovation Index ranking improved from 81 in 2015 to 46 at present due to the government’s efforts. "We have to make India a global centre of research and innovation in this Amrit Kaal. States should adopt best practices from other states," said PM Modi.

187.title: Dravid is aware that the honeymoon period is over: Ex-selector Karim
187.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim said India head coach Rahul Dravid is aware that the "honeymoon period" is over. "He's trying his best to be an alchemist but so far, such metals haven't been converted into core," added Karim. Karim stated that Dravid would "love" to swap India's triumphs in bilateral matches with the defeat in the recent fifth Test against England.

188.title: Google pays 'enormous' sums to remain top search engine: US DOJ
188.article_body: US Department of Justice (DOJ) has said Google pays "enormous" sums annually to Apple, Samsung and other telecom companies to unlawfully remain the top search engine. Google spends billions to buy "default exclusivity" on most browsers and all US mobile phones, DOJ told a federal judge on Thursday. The comments come in an antitrust lawsuit filed by DOJ in 2020.

189.title: They'll get tired one day: Kamra on right-wing groups' threats against show
189.article_body: Comedian Kunal Kamra took to Instagram to react to right-wing groups threatening to protest and disrupt his show at a bar in Gurugram if it wasn't cancelled, saying, "They'll get tired one day or I'll be irrelevant, don't know which one will be sooner." This comes as the bar's management cancelled the show. Kamra "mocks Hindu deities", right-wing groups claimed.

190.title: India's forex reserves fall to lowest level in nearly 2 years, drop below $560 billion
190.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell to their lowest level in nearly two years, data released by the Reserve Bank of India on Friday showed. The reserves fell by $7.94 billion to $553.1 billion as of September 2, marking the lowest level since October 9, 2020. The decline was led by a drop in foreign currency assets to $492.1 billion.

191.title: We were probably like dying: Ruud on 55-shot rally in US Open semi
191.article_body: Discussing the 55-shot rally in the first set of his US Open semi-final against Russia's Karen Khachanov, Norwegian tennis player Casper Ruud said, "We were...probably like dying because we were out of breath." "I felt my knees or my legs were sort of shaking," added Ruud. "I tried to not...[let] Karen feel that I am tired," he stated.

192.title: Man crashes lover's wedding in Chennai, tries to tie 'mangalsutra'
192.article_body: A 24-year-old man crashed his lover's wedding in Chennai and tried to tie 'thali' ('mangalsutra'), which he snatched from the priest, around her neck on Friday. He came to the marriage hall after the 20-year-old bride texted him to come and get her. The man was beaten up by people but he managed to stop the wedding.

193.title: Newborn girl found abandoned in Mumbai, people call police for adoption
193.article_body: A newborn girl was found abandoned near a dustbin in Mumbai's Borivali (West) area on Wednesday night. Following the incident, a police officer shared a post on Facebook and a few families contacted him expressing willingness to adopt the girl. "If she gets adopted, it would be great," said Senior Inspector Sudhir Kudalkar, who had shared the post.

194.title: Shah Rukh Khan shouldn't collaborate with me right now: Ali Zafar
194.article_body: Actor Ali Zafar in an interview stated that actor Shah Rukh Khan should not collaborate with him right now. "Wahan pe aise hi mushkilein badh jaati hain (Difficulties can increase there just like that)," the actor added. The All Indian Cine Workers Association had announced a total ban on Pakistani artistes after the Pulwama terror attack in 2019.

195.title: 'Brahmāstra' earns ₹75 crore worldwide on opening day
195.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt starrer 'Brahmāstra Part One: Shiva' has opened at worldwide gross collection of ₹75 crore. Sharing the update, the film's producer Karan Johar wrote on Instagram, "Humbled...Grateful...but yet can't control my excitement!" The film reportedly collected ₹35-36 crore in all versions at the domestic box office on the first day.

196.title: Teabag said to have been used by UK Queen put on sale for ₹9.5 lakh on eBay
196.article_body: A teabag believed to have been used by Queen Elizabeth, was put on sale on eBay for $12,000 (around ₹9.56 lakh), after her death. "This is the very teabag you might have seen on CNN in late 1998. Own a piece of History! Priceless!" said the listing. The listing has now ended and it indicates the product has been sold.

197.title: Charles proclaimed King at ceremony in London
197.article_body: Charles has been proclaimed King at the Accession Council at St James' Palace in London after the passing away of his mother Elizabeth II. The ceremony was attended by his wife, Camilla, and the heir to the throne, William. Later in the day, Senior MPs will swear an oath of allegiance to King Charles III in the Houses of Parliament.

198.title: An adventure for the big screen, can't wait for part 2: Arjun on 'Brahmāstra'
198.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram Stories to appreciate Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra'. He wrote, "An adventure for the big screen...A ride like no other...Loved watching @ayan_mukerji's vision come to life." He further wrote, "From...King Khans surprise emergence (loved it) to nag sirs action sequences...this one is a sure shot cinematic experience...cannot wait for part 2!!!"

199.title: Chadwick Boseman honoured with Disney Legends Award posthumously
199.article_body: Late actor Chadwick Boseman, known for portraying 'Black Panther', was honoured with the Disney Legends Award posthumously on Friday at D23 Expo. His brother Derrick Boseman accepted the trophy on his behalf. Derrick said in his speech, "[Chadwick] honoured his scripts with his love, his blood, his sweat, his tears. As he played these roles, he was taking chemo simultaneously."

200.title: Pitiable: Baghel on BJP sharing pic of Rahul's Burberry t-shirt
200.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel reacted to BJP sharing a picture of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi wearing a Burberry t-shirt, which reportedly costs ₹41,257, saying, "This is pitiable...when one party is uniting the country, the party that's dividing...is clinging to t-shirts and khaki shorts." Congress leader Pawan Khera also reacted to this, saying, "Those with shorts will only look at...t-shirt."

201.title: State-run OMCs to run fuel stations on solar power by 2024: Govt
201.article_body: The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas said that all state-run oil marketing companies (OMCs) will run their entire network of petrol and diesel retail stations on solar power by 2024. OMCs, including Indian Oil Corporation Ltd, Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd, together have around 75,000 fuel stations across India that will deploy solar panels.

202.title: India, US to hold next Trade Policy Forum meet soon: Piyush Goyal
202.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said India and the US will hold the next ministerial-level meeting of the Trade Policy Forum (TPF) in US soon. He further said that officials from both countries will firm up more deliverables and newer areas of engagement. Goyal also held a bilateral meeting with US Trade Representative Katherine Tai and US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo.

203.title: Certain people enjoy masala: Rakul on romance angle in 'Cuttputlli'
203.article_body: Speaking about 'Cuttputlli' being criticised for the romance angle, actress Rakul Preet Singh said that Indian films are known for the "quintessential masala". She added that there is a certain section of the audience that enjoys the romance and song-dance. "People want entertainment...If the story is thrilling and intense, a little bit of breather...makes it a family watch," Rakul said.

204.title: I'm scared of snakes, shot scene with real snake thinking it was fake: Big B
204.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan has revealed that he is scared of snakes and recalled an incident when he had to shoot a scene with a snake coming out of his chest. "They told me that we will keep a fake rubber snake...During the shoot, I was holding the snake...Later I got to know...the snake was not fake, it was...real," he said.

205.title: 5 killed after boat collides with whale in New Zealand: Report
205.article_body: Five people were reportedly killed after a small charter boat collided with a whale and capsized in New Zealand. The accident took place on Saturday morning near the South Island town of Kaikoura. The town is a popular whale-watching destination, while sperm whales are usually seen in the area. Some humpback whales also pass through.

206.title: 'Brahmāstra' ending is superb, but it will take time to build: Neetu
206.article_body: In a video shared by a media account, veteran actress Neetu Kapoor can be heard telling 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji that the film's ending is superb. She can further be heard saying, "It is outstanding, amazing. But it will...initially it takes time to build. But once the film takes off." The video was taken at a special screening of 'Brahmāstra'.

207.title: The real Kohli wasn't batting during the first 50 runs: Akhtar on Kohli's 122*
207.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar said the "real Virat Kohli" wasn't batting during the first 50 runs of Kohli's 122* (61) in the Asia Cup match against Afghanistan. Akhtar added that he saw the real Kohli bat during the last 50 runs of the knock. Talking about Virat Kohli being a potential opener in T20Is, Akhtar stated, "Don't get confused...thinking [like] that."

208.title: Teacher pours boiling water on 7-yr-old boy for defecating in school uniform in K'taka
208.article_body: A 7-year-old Class 2 student suffered 40% burns after his teacher allegedly threw hot water on him for defecating in his school uniform in Karnataka's Raichur district, police said. The boy has been admitted to Lingasugur taluk hospital and is undergoing treatment. "We have information about the incident but haven't received any complaint regarding the matter," police added.

209.title: At least 3 killed, 11 injured as trains collide in Croatia
209.article_body: At least three people were killed and 11 others were injured after a passenger train and freight train collided on Friday night in Croatia, authorities said. Both trains were pushed off the rails after the collision. The passenger train was carrying 13 people, while the engine driver was the only person in the freight train, Croatian PM Andrej Plenkovic said.

210.title: Police bust Lashkar-e-Taiba terror module in J&K's Sopore, 2 arrested
210.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Friday arrested two people from Sopore after busting an overground worker (OGW) module of the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT). Police also recovered two grenades from the arrested persons, ANI reported. During the inquiry, the detained pair divulged identities of other OGW accomplices, leading to the arrest and recovery of more weaponry and ammunition, reports added.

211.title: Construction material falls on workers in Noida; 1 dead, 4 injured
211.article_body: A 22-year-old labourer was killed and four others were injured after construction material fell on them when the rope tied around it broke in Noida on Friday. The construction material, which included iron rods, was attached to a tower crane, the police said. An FIR has been filed against four people including the construction company's director, Additional DCP (Noida) said.

212.title: India skips US-led IPEF's trade pillar, to join 3 other pillars
212.article_body: India has not joined the US-led Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity's (IPEF) 'trade pillar'. US Trade Representative Katherine Tai said, "I wouldn't characterise it as opting out, India isn't in...trade pillar right now." She added India and US have their bilateral and trade policy forum. However, India will join the three other pillars–supply chain, clean economy and fair economy.

213.title: Yami's 'Lost' to premiere at Chicago South Asian Film Fest opening night
213.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has announced that her film 'Lost' will be premiering on the opening night of the 13th Annual Chicago South Asian Film Festival. The event will be attended by director Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury, Yami and actor Rahul Khanna. The film will premiere on September 23 and will be followed by a question-answer session with the team of 'Lost'.

214.title: Reliance arm to buy SPL, SPTex's polyester business for ₹1,592 cr
214.article_body: Reliance Petroleum Retail Limited, a subsidiary of Reliance Industries Limited, will acquire the polyester business of Shubhalakshmi Polyesters Limited (SPL) and Shubhlaxmi Polytex Limited (SPTex) for ₹1,522 crore and ₹70 crore, respectively in a slump sale on a going concern basis. The acquisitions are subject to approvals from the Competition Commission of India and the lenders of SPL and SPTex.

215.title: Amazon to stop selling seat belt alarm blockers in US, UK after Mistry's car crash
215.article_body: Amazon will remove listings of products that disable car seat belt alarms in US and UK, a day after the e-commerce platform did the same in India. The development comes after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry died in a car crash last weekend. Mistry, who was in the rear seat, wasn't wearing seat belt at the time of crash.

216.title: Pics show cards, balloons, flowers at gates of Buckingham Palace after Queen's demise
216.article_body: People in the UK paid their respects to Queen Elizabeth II after her demise by leaving flowers, balloons and cards among other things at the gates of the Buckingham Palace in London. Thousands of people gathered outside Buckingham Palace amid rain. Portraits of the Queen were reportedly posted on billboard screens in central London's Piccadilly Circus and Canary Wharf.

217.title: Mining mafia attacks police, officials in Haryana's Nuh; 50 booked
217.article_body: A police constable was injured after the mining mafia attacked a joint team of police and other officials during a raid at an illegal mining site in Haryana's Nuh, police said on Friday. A juvenile was apprehended and an FIR has been filed against some identified people and around 40-50 unidentified people, a police officer said.

218.title: 14 cows die at Ludhiana shelter, contaminated fodder suspected
218.article_body: At least 14 cows were found dead at a shelter in the Samrala town of Ludhiana district on Friday. Dr Jaswinder Kaur, a veterinary specialist, suspected it to be a case of contaminated fodder after traces of nitrate were found in it. She said that fodder producers spray chemicals to increase yield, which could prove fatal if fed directly.

219.title: Shah Rukh Khan appointed as ambassador by UAE's Burjeel Holdings
219.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has been appointed as the brand ambassador for UAE's private healthcare services provider Burjeel Holdings. Burjeel Holdings is owned by UAE-based Indian entrepreneur Shamsheer Vayalil. This is Shah Rukh's first role as a healthcare ambassador. The actor said, "Meeting employees and witnessing the immense passion and pride they have in their work was humbling."

220.title: Nurse saves baby who stopped breathing on US flight; video surfaces
220.article_body: A nurse on board a Spirit Airlines flight from US' Pittsburgh to Orlando saved a baby who'd stopped breathing midair on Thursday. The video of the incident was shared by Ian Cassette, a meteorologist for Fox 35 television station in Orlando, on Twitter. According to the meteorologist, the three-month-old baby's lips had gone purple, following which nurse Tamara Panzino intervened.

221.title: 4 including 2 minor brothers die after taking 70-80 feet fall as SUV hits bike in Nagpur
221.article_body: Four members of a family were killed after they were flung into air when a Sports Utility Vehicle (SUV) rammed into their motorcycle in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Friday, police said. Reports said that the four deceased took a 70 to 80 feet fall before they died. Among the deceased are two minor boys, aged five and eleven years.

222.title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates 2 mansions in California worth $55 million
222.article_body: MacKenzie Scott, the ex-wife of Amazon Founder and the world's second richest person Jeff Bezos, has donated two mansions in California's Beverly Hills for a total of $55 million. Bezos and Scott had purchased the properties while they were married. Scott received sole ownership of these homes following her divorce from Bezos in 2019 after 25 years of marriage.

223.title: If I was Rohit, I'd tell Avesh 'Tell me if you can't bowl 140+': Akram
223.article_body: Sharing the conversation he would have with pacer Avesh Khan if he was Rohit Sharma, Wasim Akram said, "I'll tell...Avesh, 'I want you to bowl over 140 kmph, if you can't bowl...tell me'." "I don't want...135 kmph line, length bowlers," added Akram. "If Avesh cannot [bowl quick] what's the point of having him in the team," he stated.

224.title: Former RJD MLC's son arrested for misbehaving with DSP in Patna
224.article_body: Former RJD MLC Anwar Ahmed's son Afshar was arrested for allegedly misbehaving with the DSP and others inside a police station in Bihar's Patna on Friday. Afshar was reportedly forcing police to let a man go who allegedly attacked police during a raid. "He (Afshar) said...he'll come back with 5,000 people and give it a different angle," the DSP said.

225.title: If stray dogs attack people, those who feed them could be held liable: Supreme Court
225.article_body: While hearing petitions in connection with the stray dogs' menace in Kerala, Supreme Court Justice Sanjiv Khanna said that people who feed stray dogs "will be responsible for vaccinating them and bearing the cost if a person is attacked". The Supreme Court bench said that a balance has to be maintained between the safety of people and animal rights.

226.title: PM Modi inaugurates 2-day Centre-State Science Conclave virtually
226.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated the Centre-State Science Conclave being held from September 10 to 11 in Ahmedabad via video conferencing. "Investment in science and technology has increased since 2014," he said. "We have to make India a global centre of research and innovation in this 'Amrit Kaal'. States should adopt best practices from other states," he added.

227.title: 1.8-million-year-old human tooth found in Georgia; pic released
227.article_body: A 1.8-million-year-old tooth belonging to an early species of human has been found by archaeologists in Georgia. The tooth was discovered near the village of Orozmani, around 100 km southwest of the Georgian capital of Tbilisi. The village is near Dmanisi where human skulls dated to 1.8 million years old were found in the late 1990s and early 2000s.

228.title: I'm from middle-class family, watched films only when I scored well: Rakul
228.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that she comes from a middle-class family and could not watch all the films that were released when she was growing up. "My dad would say, 'Okay, you score well. So you watch that film, you do this.' So...it was tough," the actress added. Rakul was last seen in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Cuttputlli'.

229.title: Bolsonaro supporter kills Lula fan as Brazil Prez election nears
229.article_body: Ahead of the Brazilian Presidential polls in October, a supporter of President Jair Bolsonaro killed a backer of rival candidate Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva during an argument, authorities said on Friday. The 24-year-old accused has been arrested, police said, adding that Rafael Silva de Oliveira has confessed to the crime. Bolsonaro is currently trailing in the polls.

230.title: Alia Bhatt is the most focused actor in film industry: Shefali Shah
230.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has stated in an interview that Alia Bhatt is the most focused actor in the film industry. The two shared screen space together in Alia's first production venture 'Darlings'. Speaking about her career, Shefali said her potential was not tapped well before she did the series 'Delhi Crime', adding, "Better late than never perfectly describes my journey."

231.title: Please don't leak spoilers of 'Brahmāstra' on social media: Ranbir
231.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, who recently held a special screening of 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' for fans, requested them not to leak any spoilers on social media. He can be heard saying in a video, "The audience who has not seen it would like to experience it." Ranbir also signed autographs and clicked selfies with fans at the event.

232.title: Ex-Tesla CFO Deepak Ahuja to join US drone delivery startup Zipline
232.article_body: Ex-Tesla CFO Deepak Ahuja will join San Francisco-based drone delivery startup Zipline as its first Chief Business and Financial Officer. "Rarely do I see this level of disruption and impact paired with the world-class technology that Zipline's team is building," Ahuja said. He'll be leaving his post of CFO at Alphabet's Verily Life Sciences to join Zipline on September 30.

233.title: 3 people try to sell baby girl for ₹4.5 lakh, arrested in Faridabad
233.article_body: Haryana CM's Flying Squad has arrested three people after they were caught red-handed while trying to sell a six-month-old girl in Faridabad. A member of the squad had posed as a buyer and the trio agreed to sell the baby for ₹4.5 lakh, officials said. The trio revealed that they'd sold a child earlier in Delhi, a sub-inspector said.

234.title: 'After Aashiqui 2', 'Ek Villain', I thought I'll write a book: Shraddha
234.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor recently launched the book 'Treasure Trove' written by 8-year-old Arya and read out a chapter at the event. Shraddha said she thought it would be great to write a book. "It was around 2014, my film 'Aashiqui 2' had already released, later 'Ek Villain' released as well...I...started understanding the creative process of what I do," she added.

235.title: Rahul Gandhi begins 4th day of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kanniyakumari
235.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi began the fourth day of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kanniyakumari's Mulagumoodu on Saturday. The party aims to cover about 3,570 km journey from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir during the campaign which kicked off on Wednesday. On Friday, Gandhi said the 'yatra' is an attempt to "undo the damage caused by the BJP and RSS".

236.title: Have always tried to maintain harmony with govt: Raj Guv Kalraj Mishra
236.article_body: Rajasthan Governor Kalraj Mishra said that he has always tried to maintain harmony with Ashok Gehlot-led Congress government in the state. "If there is a difficulty at any level and of any kind, then it is addressed through continuous dialogue and communication," Mishra said while talking to reporters to mark the completion of his three years as Governor of Rajasthan.

237.title: Journalist Siddique likely to be released next week from UP jail: Official
237.article_body: Journalist Siddique Kappan who was arrested under Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA) is likely to be released from the Lucknow jail next week, an official said. SC granted him bail on Friday and stated that every person has right to free expression. He was arrested while he was on his way to Hathras where a Dalit woman had died.

238.title: UK envoy condoles Queen's demise in Hindi, says 'Maharani Elizabeth ko yaad kiya jayega'
238.article_body: British High Commissioner to India Alex Ellis spoke in Hindi while condoling Queen Elizabeth II's demise. "Maharani Elizabeth ko unke jeevan, nishtha...aur kartaviya seva ke liye United Kingdom,  Bharat, Commonwealth ke desho, puri duniya mein yaad kiya jayega...Queen Elizabeth had a long life, an exemplary life of strength, duty, hard work and dignity," Ellis said.

239.title: King Charles told Harry not to bring wife Meghan to see dying Queen: Report
239.article_body: King Charles told his son Harry not to bring wife Meghan Markle to Balmoral Castle as he and other senior Royals rushed to see dying Queen, a source told The Sun. "Charles made it very, very clear Meghan would not be welcome," the source reportedly said. Harry was at Frogmore Cottage when he received a call from his father.

240.title: Car in Mistry's accident was at 100 kmph speed seconds before crash: Mercedes report
240.article_body: The car in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed, was running at a speed of 100 kmph seconds before the accident, according to a preliminary report submitted by Mercedes-Benz. Its speed was 89 kmph when it hit the divider, Palghar Superintendent of Police said citing the report, adding that the brakes were applied five seconds before crash.

241.title: I signed 3 films even after 'Love Aaj Kal 2' flopped: Kartik Aaryan
241.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has stated in an interview that he signed three films after the critical and commercial failure of 2020 film 'Love Aaj Kal 2'. "After playing two roles in the film, filmmakers started seeing me in that light," he said. The actor further said that director Imtiaz Ali's "magic" presented his serious side in the film.

242.title: India reports 5,554 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 48,850
242.article_body: India has reported 5,554 fresh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 6,322 people recovered in the last 24 hours. This comes a day after 6,093 COVID-19 cases were reported in the country. Active cases in India stand at 48,850.

243.title: Instagram tests 'reposts' feature for resharing posts in feed
243.article_body: Meta's Instagram is testing a new feature that will allow users to repost other users' posts in their own feeds. "We plan to test this soon with a small number of people," Meta said. Currently, users can share someone's posts in their Stories. Reportedly, users will be able to see all reshared posts in a separate tab on their profiles.

244.title: 'Machis ki dibbi' worth thousands of crores: Baghel on ministry building
244.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel called the ministry building in Naya Raipur a 'machis ki dibbi' (matchbox). Calling it a symbol of corruption, he alleged that the BJP spent thousands of crores of rupees to build it but it is in ruins today. "When the wind blows, the walls shake and the windows rattle," he said.

245.title: Copyright lawsuit against Fortis Healthcare dismissed by US court
245.article_body: A US court dismissed a copyright lawsuit filed by Emqore Envesecure against Fortis Healthcare and others, including IHH Healthcare Berhad, Fortis said. The suit was dismissed on grounds of 'forum non conveniens', which is a discretionary power allowing courts to dismiss a case where another court/forum is better suited to hear the case. Emqore had sought $6.5 billion in damages.

246.title: 19-yr-old who put college on hold to build his crypto startup raises $30 mn in US
246.article_body: Tate Berenbaum, the 19-year-old Founder of Community Labs, has raised $30 million in funding for his crypto startup. Berenbaum told Bloomberg that he has moved to New York and has put his first year at the University of Virginia on hold to build the startup. He further said he spent most of the time coding in his basement during COVID-19.

247.title: My wife & 2 kids perished, I lost everything: Then Taj hotel GM on 26/11 attacks
247.article_body: Karambir Kang, who was the Taj Mahal Palace hotel's General Manager during 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, urged the international community at a UN convention to act against terrorism. "My wife and two young sons could not escape and died during the attack, I lost everything...Our company and staff...have spent 14 long and painful years trying to seek justice," he said.

248.title: Everything runs on fakeness in Bollywood: Vivek on 'Brahmāstra'
248.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri shared a report saying 'Brahmāstra' led to ₹800 crore loss for two theatre chains, writing on Twitter, "Problem is everything runs on fakeness in Bollywood." The filmmaker further wrote, "And nobody is answerable. No industry can survive which invests 0% in R&D and wastes 70-80% money on stars." 'Brahmāstra' features Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt and Amitabh Bachchan.

249.title: Missing boy found murdered in Pune; father received ₹20 cr ransom call
249.article_body: A seven-year-old boy, who was reported missing, was found murdered on the premises of a company on Friday in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad, police said. The father of the boy, who was last seen playing near his residence, had allegedly received a ransom call demanding ₹20 crore. The police said that they're investigating to confirm the cause behind the murder.

250.title: FM Sitharaman asks RBI to prepare 'whitelist' of legal loan apps
250.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has asked the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to prepare a "whitelist" of all the legal lending apps to single out those illegal apps using unethical means to exploit customers. The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology will ensure that app stores such as Google Play Store or Apple App Store only host these "whitelist" apps.

251.title: A threat to peace: France on North Korea's new nuclear law
251.article_body: France condemned North Korea's new law, which allows it to carry out a preemptive nuclear attack to protect itself. "This new escalation on the part of...North Korea...represents a threat to international and regional peace and security," French Foreign Ministry said. North Korean leader Kim Jong-un called the decision "irreversible" and ruled out the possibility of any talks on denuclearisation.

252.title: Kunal Kamra's Gurugram show cancelled after threats by VHP, Bajrang Dal
252.article_body: The management of a bar in Gurugram has cancelled comedian Kunal Kamra's show, scheduled to take place on September 17 and 18, after members of Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) threatened to protest. In a memorandum submitted to the deputy commissioner, right-wing groups claimed Kamra "mocks Hindu deities in his shows" and requested the show to be cancelled.

253.title: Lucknow hotel fire probe report submitted, 6 depts held responsible; action suggested
253.article_body: Probe report about Hotel Levana fire mishap has been submitted to the state government. The report has held six departments including Lucknow Development Authority (LDA), Lucknow Electricity Supply Administration (LESA), Fire Services, Excise Department, District Administration and Lucknow Municipal Corporation responsible for the incident. Action has been suggested against several officers.

254.title: Don't want SC to be 'tareekh pe tareekh' court: Justice Chandrachud
254.article_body: The Supreme Court refused to grant an adjournment sought by a counsel in a case on Friday. Justice DY Chandrachud said, "We don't want the Supreme Court to be 'tareekh pe tareekh' court. We want to change this perception." "This is the highest court of the land and we want certain dignity to be attached to this court," he added.

255.title: Kangana meets President, says she looks like a goddess on her throne
255.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Friday shared pictures on social media of meeting President Droupadi Murmu. The actress wrote alongside the pictures, "Her gentle voice, calm demeanour and compassionate gaze is another worldly...Sitting on that chair/ throne she looks nothing short of a goddess/ Shakti who nurtures, heals and guides." She further wrote that the President appreciated her for her work.

256.title: Artificial ponds to be constructed for immersion of idols in Delhi
256.article_body: Delhi Jal Board Vice Chairman Saurabh Bharadwaj has directed the administration to construct artificial ponds for immersion of idols ahead of Durga Puja festivity. "During Durga Puja in Delhi, huge crowds of devotees gather to celebrate. All necessary instructions have been given to the officials concerned to ensure that there is no problem during the immersion," said Bharadwaj.

257.title: Babar mouths 'I'm captain' after umpire signals DRS without his consent, video viral
257.article_body: A video went viral showing Pakistan captain Babar Azam repeatedly mouthing 'I am the captain' to umpire Anil Chaudhary after the latter signalled DRS without his consent during Sri Lanka's innings. Chaudhary signalled DRS after Muhammad Rizwan appealed for a caught behind and called for DRS. Babar suggested to Chaudhary that he can't signal DRS unless captain gives consent.

258.title: 'Brahmāstra' becomes biggest non-holiday Hindi release
258.article_body: Ayan Mukerji directorial 'Brahmāstra' earned ₹35-36 crore on its opening day, recording the biggest non-holiday opening for a Hindi film. The film's collection has beaten Ranbir Kapoor's highest opener so far 'Sanju' which earned ₹34.75 crore on its opening. SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' holds the record for the highest opening on a non-holiday with a ₹41 crore collection.

259.title: Afg lose to everyone, they won't win unless fans change behaviour: Inzamam
259.article_body: Talking about the behaviour of the Afghanistan fans following their team's defeat against Pakistan, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said, "I was really shocked...[and] disappointed." "Afghanistan lose to everyone...If the fans don't change their attitude, their team won't win going ahead also," added Inzamam. "It is the second time I am witnessing such shocking behaviour from them," he stated.

260.title: Will be successful in defeating BJP if Opposition is united: Tejashwi
260.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav pitched for Opposition unity for 2024 general elections. Talking about CM Nitish Kumar’s recent meetings with the Opposition leaders including Congress MP Rahul Gandhi in Delhi, he said, “It is a good thing. It has been clearly said that if all of us are united, we will be successful (in defeating BJP).”

261.title: King Charles kissed by woman as he greets people outside Buckingham Palace
261.article_body: Video showing a woman kissing King Charles III on the cheek as he greeted people outside the Buckingham Palace has surfaced online. The new monarch returned to London on Friday after being present when Queen Elizabeth II passed away at Balmoral on Thursday. Another woman was seen kissing the King on the hand.

262.title: IIT graduate fined ₹50,000 by Supreme Court over his 'Kashmir solution' petition
262.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday imposed a fine of ₹50,000 on an IIT graduate over his "Kashmir solution" petition. The petitioner named Prabhakar Venkatesh Deshpande sought implementation of Manmohan-Musharraf 4-point formula. The bench said it is putting the counsel for the petitioner on notice that it will impose cost on him for wasting the court's time with such petitions.

263.title: Virat Kohli's 122* has thrown a spanner in the works: Ravi Shastri
263.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Virat Kohli's 122* (61) in the Asia Cup match against Afghanistan has "thrown" a "spanner in the works". "It's allowed now for the selectors to think, 'Do we need a third opener?'" added Shastri. "It allows you to have an extra pacer as well as an extra batter in the middle order," he stated.

264.title: BJP comes to Chhattisgarh to learn our development model: Baghel
264.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel criticised BJP and said that the BJP chief JP Nadda was visiting the state to study Congress' development model. "BJP comes here to learn our state model. Our schemes have been adopted by the Centre. BJP doesn't fight alone, uses agencies like ED, IT and CBI," added Baghel.

265.title: Musk cites Twitter's $7.75 mn payout to whistleblower as another reason to end deal
265.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has sent a third letter to Twitter in an attempt to terminate his $44 billion acquisition of the company. Twitter's $7.75 million payment to whistleblower Peiter Zatko is a violation of merger agreement, Musk's lawyers said in latest notice. Twitter didn't seek Musk's consent for payment nor was it disclosed to him, they added.

266.title: Congress MP shares Sarma's 2010 tweet on Rahul, warns PM about Sarma
266.article_body: After Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma shared a parody video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, party MP Manickam Tagore on Friday shared a picture of Sarma's 2010 tweet that said, "Rahul Gandhi will [be] Prime Minister of our country in an appropriate time." Tagore questioned whom Sarma was cheating and told PM Narendra Modi that he should "beware" of him.

267.title: BJP names former CM Biplab Deb for Rajya Sabha bypoll in Tripura
267.article_body: The BJP on Friday nominated former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb as the party's candidate for the upcoming bypoll to the lone Rajya Sabha seat in the state. The seat fell vacant after Dr Manik Saha resigned following his appointment as Chief Minister of Tripura. Notably, the announcement came hours after Deb was made Haryana state in-charge by the party.

268.title: Will be more dangerous if jailed: Imran Khan amid terror charges
268.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan, who's facing terrorism charges, warned that he would become "more dangerous" if sent to jail. Khan also expressed discontent over the large police presence outside the Islamabad High Court during the hearing of the case on Thursday. Khan was booked under the Anti-Terrorism Act for allegedly threatening a judge and police officials at a rally.

269.title: 3 children drown during Ganesh idol immersion in Ganga river in UP
269.article_body: Two children drowned and one died during treatment after they went to immerse Ganesh idols in the Ganga river in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, police said. The incident took place on Friday as the Ganesh Chaturthi festival came to an end. This comes as four children drowned in the Aami river during immersion of Ganesh idols in Sant Kabir Nagar.

270.title: 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz becomes youngest man to reach US Open final in 32 years
270.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz has become the youngest man to reach US Open final since Pete Sampras (19 years) in 1990. The world number four defeated world number 26 France Tiafoe 6-7(6-8), 6-3, 6-1, 6-7(5-7), 6-3 in the US Open 2022 men's singles semi-final. Alcaraz has reached the final of a Grand Slam for the first time.

271.title: Bengaluru reports 337 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
271.article_body: Bengaluru reported 337 new COVID-19 infections on Friday, taking the cumulative total to 18,68,079 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 2,733, while the infection positivity rate stood at 2.57%.

272.title: Man swims in living room of luxurious villa in flooded Bengaluru; video goes viral
272.article_body: A video showing a man swimming in the living room of a luxurious villa in Bengaluru's Epsilon amid severe waterlogging and floods has gone viral online. The video shows several household items floating around him and a piano submerged in water. Epsilon is home to many businessmen, such as Wipro Executive Chairman Rishad Premji and Britannia Managing Director Varun Berry.

273.title: Ukrainian soldiers write tributes to Queen on bombs before firing them at Russian forces
273.article_body: Ukrainian soldiers wrote tributes to Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away aged 96, on bombs before firing them at Russian forces. Pictures shared on Twitter by a user whose profile described him as a Ukrainian artilleryman in Kyiv's Air Assault Brigade showed "RIP Queen Elizabeth II" written on a bomb. Another picture showed tributes written in Ukrainian.

274.title: US payments company Bolt Financial scraps $1.5 bn deal to buy Wyre
274.article_body: Bolt Financial, the San Francisco-based online payments company, said on Friday that it has scrapped its $1.5 billion deal to buy cryptocurrency infrastructure provider Wyre Payments. Bolt Financial, however, said that it will continue its existing commercial partnership with Wyre Payments. Bolt Financial was valued at $11 billion after a funding round in January this year.

275.title: Chhattisgarh CM inaugurates 2 new districts in state, total district tally now 33
275.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel inaugurated Manendragarh-Chirmiri-Bharatpur and Sakti as the state's 32nd and 33rd districts on Friday. An official said that Sakti has been carved out from Janjgir-Champa while Manendragarh-Chirmiri-Bharatpur has been formed from Korea district. Baghel talked about long struggle to make Manendragarh-Chirmiri-Bharatpur a district.

276.title: Ukraine has retaken over 1,000 sq km since Sept 1: Zelenskyy
276.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claimed that Kyiv's forces have "liberated" more than 1,000 sq km of territory since September 1. Over 30 settlements have been "liberated" in the Kharkiv region, Zelenskyy said. Russia's top official in Kharkiv region, Vitaly Ganchev, confirmed to Russian state TV that Ukrainians had broken through the Russian defence line and had won a "significant victory".

277.title: Congress to release white paper on 'flooded and potholed Bengaluru'
277.article_body: The Congress party said it has formed a committee to bring out a report titled 'Vision Bengaluru, Better Bengaluru' on the city's infrastructure within 20 days. AICC General Secretary Randeep Surjewala said that the committee would release a white paper on the 'flooded and potholed Bengaluru' within a week to "expose the maladministration and corruption".

278.title: Ashneer criticised for calling employees 'daily wagers in guise of salaried folk'
278.article_body: BharatPe's former MD Ashneer Grover was criticised after he called employees "daily wagers in guise of salaried folk" in response to EaseMyTrip Co-founder Prashant Pitti's post on hired candidates backing out at the last minute. A Twitter user wrote, "How do you manage to stoop so low?", while other replied, "Treat them like...daily wagers and they will act...like...daily wagers do."

279.title: ₹61.7 lakh-gold found under seat in flight, seized at Pune airport
279.article_body: Gold biscuits worth ₹61.7 lakh were seized after they were found hidden under the seat in a SpiceJet flight at the Pune International Airport, customs officials said on Friday. The gold biscuits were found in a pouch, wrapped by a black plastic sheet, Pune Customs said. It added that the gold biscuits weigh 1,166.4 gram and are of 999 purity.

280.title: Mason falls from 19th floor as lift cable snaps, dies in Gurugram
280.article_body: A 38-year-old mason died after allegedly falling from the 19th floor of an under-construction building when the cable of the lift he was repairing snapped in Gurugram's Sector 65, police said. The deceased's brother-in-law claimed that he died due to the "negligence of the contractor and builder as they had not provided...any safety equipment". The incident occurred on Wednesday.

281.title: Sweeper, guard die after inhaling toxic gases inside sewer in Delhi
281.article_body: Two men died after inhaling toxic gases while cleaning a sewer in Delhi's Bakkarwala area on Friday. According to police, the victims were identified as Rohit Chandilya, who worked as a sweeper, and security guard Ashok, who went inside the sewer to rescue Chandilya. The two were taken to a nearby hospital where they were declared brought dead, reports said.

282.title: 5 injured as tree falls on Ganpati pandal, car in Thane's Kolbad
282.article_body: Five people were injured after a tree fell on a Ganpati pandal and a car in Kolbad in Maharashtra's Thane city amid heavy rains on Friday. According to Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief, Avinash Sawant, the incident took place at around 8 pm near Jagmata temple. "Of the five injured, two...sustained serious wounds and are hospitalised," Sawant added.

283.title: Fan gifts Sonu Sood his painting made with blood, actor says 'donate blood instead'
283.article_body: A fan met and gifted Sonu Sood a painting of him made with blood. Reacting to the video of the meeting, the actor tweeted, "Donate blood, my brother, don't waste it by making my painting with blood. Thank you very much." In the video, the fan can be heard saying that he can sacrifice his life for Sood.

284.title: Australia captain Finch retires from ODI cricket after scoring 26 runs in last 7 innings
284.article_body: Australia's white-ball captain Aaron Finch has announced his retirement from ODI cricket. The third Australia-New Zealand ODI on Sunday will be his last ODI. The 35-year-old's decision comes after scoring 26 runs in his last seven innings. Finch has played 145 ODIs, scoring 5,401 runs, including 17 hundreds. "It has been a fantastic ride with some incredible memories," Finch said.

285.title: IMD predicts rain, issues orange alert in Hyderabad till Sunday
285.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert in Hyderabad till Sunday. The city is likely to witness rains that could lead to waterlogging on roads and low-lying areas and cause traffic jams, according to IMD. Water and electricity could be disrupted for a few hours, it added. Notably, Ganesh idol immersions are being undertaken this weekend.

286.title: US President Joe Biden to attend Queen Elizabeth II's funeral
286.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that he'll attend the funeral of Queen Elizabeth II in Britain. "I don't know the details yet, but I'll be going," Biden told reporters. The date of the funeral has not been confirmed, but it's expected to take place in Westminster Abbey in London on September 19. The Queen died on Thursday aged 96.

287.title: Charles ends his 1st address as King with quote sung at Diana's funeral
287.article_body: King Charles made a reference to a song performed at Princess Diana's funeral as he paid tribute to his mother the Queen on Friday evening. Ending his address, King Charles III said, "May flights of angels sing thee to thy rest." It was a reference to lyrics from Song for Athene, which was performed at Diana's funeral in 1997.

288.title: Said 'can't get film so easily', Anurag said 'Are you mad': Huma on film offer
288.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said filmmaker Anurag Kashyap told her that he would cast her in a movie when she had first come to Mumbai. "I said, 'I've just come to Bombay. I've heard you have to struggle a lot. You can't get a film so easily.' Then he is like, 'Are you mad?' I am like 'A bit.'," she added.

289.title: 6 die in Haryana's Sonipat, Mahendragarh during Ganesh idol immersion; CM expresses grief
289.article_body: Four people died in Mahendragarh while two others died in Sonipat in Haryana during the Lord Ganesha idol immersion on Friday. Nine youths had been swept away in a canal in Mahendragarh. While four died, others were rescued. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar expressed his condolences. "We...stand with the families of...deceased in this difficult time," he wrote on Twitter.

290.title: Pilot announces Queen Elizabeth II's death before landing in London, video surfaces
290.article_body: A video of a British Airways pilot making a mid-flight announcement about the death of Queen Elizabeth II has surfaced online. "The Queen passed away earlier today...I thought at the moment I should at least tell you...because I know many will be very, very sad about this," the pilot said 40 minutes before landing at the Heathrow Airport in London.

291.title: Max Verstappen, AlphaTauri's Tsunoda get grid penalties for Italian GP
291.article_body: Red Bull F1 driver Max Verstappen is set to reportedly take another grid penalty during the 2022 Italian GP for changing an engine component. AlphaTauri's Yuki Tsunoda has meanwhile been confirmed to get a 10-place penalty for accumulating reprimands from the race stewards. Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton, Haas' Mick Schumacher and Alfa Romeo's Valtteri Bottas are also taking penalties.

292.title: Liverpool looking to replace Jurgen Klopp with Luis Enrique: Report
292.article_body: Liverpool are reportedly looking to replace manager Jurgen Klopp with Spain national team head coach Luis Enrique emerging as the frontrunner for the post. Liverpool have managed to win only two matches from seven games across all competitions this season. A report claimed Liverpool have already contacted Enrique but Klopp might be given time till January.

293.title: MakeMyTrip announces India’s 15 most-loved homestays of 2022
293.article_body: MakeMyTrip shared that it has released the list of India's Favourite Homestays Awards (IFHA) winners in association with The Times of India. Chosen by 5,00,000+ consumer votes across India and assessed by an expert jury that included Twinkle Khanna, this list of 15 homestays in India is a must-try for your next vacation, said MakeMyTrip.

294.title: ₹32 lakh seized after ED raids on Punjab MLA, others in bank fraud case
294.article_body: The ED on Friday seized hard drives and ₹32 lakh in cash after raiding the premises of Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra and others. Raids were conducted on directors of Tara Corporation Limited and their associates in an alleged bank loan fraud. The ED said the accused inflated TCL's turnover through "bogus firms" and siphoned off loan funds.

295.title: India's kharif rice output to fall due to less sowing area: Govt
295.article_body: India's rice production could decrease by around 6.5 million tonnes during this year's Kharif season due to reduction in sowing area, the government said. However, the government asserted there will be surplus output. On Thursday, a ban on exporting broken rice was imposed. Further, export duty of 20% on non-basmati rice was also imposed.

296.title: Direct tax collection rose by 35% this fiscal till Sep 8: IT data
296.article_body: Direct tax collection, which includes personal income tax, increased by 35.46% to ₹6.48 lakh crore in the current financial year till September 8, according to the Income Tax (IT) Department's data. Direct tax collection after net refunds stood at ₹5.29 lakh crore. The country's GDP growth was at 13.5% in the first quarter of this fiscal ending June 30, 2022.

297.title: WHO launching $1.5 billion campaign against meningitis in Africa
297.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) said it is launching a $1.5 billion campaign to eliminate bacterial meningitis across Africa by 2030. WHO Regional Director, Africa, Matshidiso Moeti said "a next generation" vaccine against meningitis will be available in the worst-affected countries. Over 50 million African children had their meningitis vaccinations delayed due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

298.title: Section 144 imposed in J&K's Rajouri due to 'communal tension'
298.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration imposed prohibitory orders under Section 144 in Rajouri town on Friday citing “communal tension”. The decision was taken following a group's procession call after Friday prayers over a land dispute. With the order, the assembly of four or more people in public places has been restrained.

299.title: Sweden set for election on Sep 11 amid concerns over energy bills
299.article_body: Sweden is set for Parliamentary elections on Sunday, with rising energy costs due to the Russia-Ukraine war and violent crimes at home being the most-discussed topics. Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson of the Social Democrats currently enjoys a high approval rating. Andersson became Sweden's first female prime minister less than a year ago.

300.title: Chinese shadowing our warships in South China Sea: Australia
300.article_body: Australia's Navy chief Vice Admiral Mark Hammond on Friday said the Chinese Navy's "unusual behaviour" of shadowing Australian warships in South China Sea hadn't deterred operations. "Routinely whenever we have a ship up there, there's a PLA (People's Liberation Army) navy vessel...following us around," he said. Hammond was speaking ahead of next week's multination naval exercise 'Kakadu'.

301.title: EU & Thailand seal partnership deal ending years of strained ties
301.article_body: The European Union (EU) and Thailand sealed a Partnership and Cooperation Agreement (PCA) on Friday, as both sides make efforts to repair relations which were strained following a military coup in Bangkok in 2014. This is the EU's sixth PCA agreement with a Southeast Asian country. The PCA improves bilateral ties on multiple issues, including human rights, and counterterrorism.

302.title: Saba shares dad Mansoor's pic with Queen Elizabeth II, says 'End of an era'
302.article_body: Late Indian cricketer Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi's daughter Saba Pataudi took to Instagram to share a picture of him with Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away on Thursday. "An end of an Era. R.I.P #queenelizabeth...She'll be remembered. #Lord's #cricket #ground," she wrote. In the picture, Mansoor is seen standing next to the Queen, as she shook hands with other cricketers.

303.title: Former Union Ministers, ex-CMs handed state party roles by BJP
303.article_body: The BJP has announced in-charges, co-in-charges and 'prabharis' for 15 states, including poll-bound northeast states. National General Secretary Tarun Chugh is now the new Telangana 'prabhari', while former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb has been appointed for Haryana. Sambit Patra is the coordinator for northeast states and former I&B minister Prakash Javadekar is the 'prabhari' for Kerala.

304.title: 4 children drown in UP's Aami river during immersion of Ganesh idol
304.article_body: Four children drowned in Aami river in Uttar Pradesh's Sant Kabir Nagar during the immersion of Ganesh idol on Friday, police officials said. The bodies were recovered with the help of fishermen and have been sent for postmortem. The deceased were identified as six-year-old Pauphia, six-year-old Ajit, eight-year-old Ruby and 11-year-old Dipali, Superintendent of Police said.

305.title: King Charles delivers 1st speech as British monarch, says 'My mother was an inspiration'
305.article_body: King Charles III delivered his first speech as Britain's monarch on Friday and paid tribute to his mother Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away aged 96. "Throughout her life...my beloved mother was an inspiration and example to me and...all my family," said Charles. "We owe her the most heartfelt debt any family can owe to their mother," he added.

306.title: I'd love Carlos Alcaraz to win 30 Grand Slams: Coach Juan Carlos
306.article_body: Praising world number four Carlos Alcaraz after he reached his maiden Grand Slam semi-final at US Open, his coach Juan Carlos said, "I'd love for him to win 30 Grand Slams. He has a chance of winning many." He added, "First step is to win the first." The 19-year-old beat 11th-seeded Jannik Sinner in five hours 15 minutes in quarter-final.

307.title: One of the best: Patrick on Alcaraz-Sinner's 5hr 15min US Open quarter-final
307.article_body: Commenting on the quarter-final match between Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner at US Open 2022, Simona Halep's coach Patrick Mouratoglou said it was probably "one of the best matches" he has seen in a long time. Alcaraz beat Sinner 6-3, 6-7(7-9), 6-7(0-7), 7-5, 6-3 in five hours 15 minutes. It was the second-longest match in the history of US Open.

308.title: What is the protocol for internet shutdowns?: SC to Centre
308.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the Centre whether there is a protocol for internet shutdowns. The apex court was hearing a plea which alleged arbitrary internet shutdowns in Arunachal Pradesh, Gujarat, Rajasthan and West Bengal. The SC bench said instead of issuing notices to the four states, notice should be sent to the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

309.title: Congress should refuel in BJP states during 'Bharat Jodo': HS Puri
309.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has "advised" the Congress to refuel their vehicles in BJP-ruled states to save money during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Congress leaders can save around ₹1,050 to ₹2,205 per diesel vehicle while traversing through 12 states- 3,500 km," said Puri's tweet. He tweeted a graphic which claimed that fuel in BJP-ruled states is comparatively cheaper.

310.title: PM Modi discusses energy, climate, blue economy with Norwegian PM
310.article_body: PM Narendra Modi had a telephone conversation with his Norwegian counterpart Jonas Gahr Støre on Friday. They discussed bilateral and international issues including initiatives to mobilise climate finance for renewable energy projects in developing countries. "[They discussed their] cooperation in the fields of...climate...investments and blue economy," the Norwegian Prime Minister's Office said.

311.title: Sri Lanka defeat Pakistan in Super 4 stage ahead of their Asia Cup 2022 final
311.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the last Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match. Put into bat first, Pakistan were dismissed for 121, with Sri Lanka spinner Wanindu Hasaranga registering bowling figures of 4-0-21-3. Sri Lanka chased down the target in 17 overs, with their opener Pathum Nissanka scoring an unbeaten 55 off 48 deliveries.

312.title: Pakistan rehire Matthew Hayden as mentor for T20 World Cup
312.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board has rehired former Australia cricketer Matthew Hayden as the team mentor for the ICC T20 World Cup in Australia. Hayden had an earlier stint with Pakistan during last year's T20 World Cup in UAE. "I welcome Matthew Hayden...He is a proven performer with his credentials acknowledged and recognised world-over," said PCB Chairman Ramiz Raja.

313.title: Last year was very new experience, balancing was difficult: Neeraj Chopra
313.article_body: Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra said commercial obligations and social commitments took a toll on him last year but he has learnt from his experience. "Last year was a very new experience for me, balancing was difficult," said Chopra. He added that during the off-season he worked on his technique, which helped him win the Diamond League final.

314.title: What are Kohli and Sachin's all-format stats after 71 international hundreds?
314.article_body: Virat Kohli on Thursday smashed his 71st hundred in his 522nd innings in international cricket. Sachin Tendulkar had reached 71 international hundreds in 523 innings. Kohli scored 24,002 runs in his first 522 innings in international cricket, while Sachin had aggregated 23,274 runs in his first 523 innings. Kohli's average after 71 international hundreds is 53.81, while Sachin's was 49.51.

315.title: India already united: Anurag Thakur on Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
315.article_body: Criticising the Congress over 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Friday said India is already united under PM Narendra Modi's leadership. "The double-engine (BJP) government in both the Centre and State has worked together to take the state and country forward," Thakur said. "We can't let the country get divided and must work with unity," he added.

316.title: My English has improved but is not very good yet: Neeraj Chopra
316.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, who became the first Indian to win Diamond Trophy on Thursday, said his English has improved but isn't "very good" yet. "However...I've learnt it to a point where I understand what others want to say...make others understand what I want to say. Athletics is a global sport & knowing basics help," he added.

317.title: India's WC-winning captains Dhoni, Kapil Dev watch US Open match together, pic viral
317.article_body: India's World Cup-winning captains MS Dhoni and Kapil Dev were spotted watching Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner's US Open men's quarter-final match. Reacting to video that surfaced online showing Dhoni and Kapil watching the match at Arthur Ashe Stadium, a fan tweeted, "They're being identified and getting roars even in US." Kapil also shared a picture of him with Dhoni.

318.title: Sabalenka wears sunglasses at press conference to hide tears after losing US Open semi
318.article_body: World number six Aryna Sabalenka wore sunglasses and a cap at the press conference to hide her tears after losing the US Open women's singles semi-final against world number one Iga Swiatek. The 24-year-old lost the semi-final with a scoreline of 6-3, 1-6, 4-6. "Can't begin to imagine how horrible she feels," a fan tweeted.

319.title: Appreciate Rahul Gandhi’s endeavours: Meghalaya Governor Malik
319.article_body: Meghalaya governor Satya Pal Malik praised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi saying he "appreciates his endeavours" and said he "hoped" the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will "have some good outcomes for the country". Malik added that the nation's security will be impacted if "its military and farmers were not strong". He also criticised the renaming of Delhi's Rajpath to 'Kartavya Path'.

320.title: Ex-Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains' bail application rejected in rape case
320.article_body: A court in Punjab's Ludhiana on Friday rejected the bail application of Lok Insaaf Party leader and former Punjab MLA, Simarjeet Singh Bains, in a rape case. Bains' brother and personal assistant, who were also co-accused in the case, had been bailed out on August 12 and 25, respectively. A 44-year-old woman alleged that Bains had raped her multiple times.

321.title: Everyone who called him genius should be jailed: Kangana on Brahmastra director
321.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has shared a post on her Instagram Stories criticising 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji. "Everyone who called @ayan_mukerji a genius should be jailed immediately," Kangana wrote, adding, "He took 12 years to make this film, he replaced 14 DOPs...he shot for more than 400 days for this film and changed 85 ADs and burnt ₹600 crores to ashes."

322.title: Hrithik gets angry & shouts at fan after he forcibly takes selfie with actor, video viral
322.article_body: A video shows Hrithik Roshan getting angry after a fan forcibly took a selfie with him. The incident took place when he was leaving a theatre with his sons. Hrithik is seen standing outside his car when the fan blocked his son's way and broke past the security for a selfie. "What are you doing?" Hrithik can be heard shouting.

323.title: Need to be flexible in our batting: Harmanpeet ahead of 1st India-Eng T20I
323.article_body: Ahead of first India Women-England Women T20I, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said her side needs to be flexible in their batting approach in T20Is. On closing out the matches, Harmanpreet said, "We are working on that. I know for a long time these things are troubling us. We need to show some patience." First T20I will be played on Saturday.

324.title: Video shows Raj man attacking employer with sharp weapons after being sacked
324.article_body: A video showing a man attacking his employer with sharp weapons along with his friends after being allegedly sacked from his job has gone viral on social media. The men in the video are then seen running away from the spot on bikes. The incident reportedly took place in Rajasthan's Kota. The man has reportedly suffered injuries.

325.title: 39.5 kilograms of heroin worth ₹197 crore seized near Kolkata port
325.article_body: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) and Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) detected 39.5 kilograms of heroin worth ₹197.82 crore in 72 hidden packets in Kolkata. "The contraband was found concealed inside 12 gear boxes which were part of 7,220 kilograms of metal scrap sent from Jebel Ali Port in Dubai in a shipping container...[that] reached Kolkata port," Gujarat DGP said.

326.title: Assam CM posts musical video to mock Rahul Gandhi; Congress reacts
326.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday mocked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi by posting a musical video on Twitter in which Rahul was portrayed as a cartoon character. The video, entitled 'Rahul naam mera', included references to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. In response, Congress leader Srinivas BV posted an earlier viral video showing Sarma scratching himself and tweeted, "Himanta naam tera."

327.title: RPF jawan saves woman from going under moving train in UP; video out
327.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a Railway Protection Force (RPF) jawan saving a woman from getting under a speeding train in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad. The video showed the woman crossing a railway track and trying to get onto the platform. The jawan was seen rushing towards her and pulling her onto the platform seconds before the train passed.

328.title: All football games in England postponed until Monday, cricket to go ahead
328.article_body: All football fixtures in England have been postponed until Monday due to the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, English football's ruling body announced. However, cricket fixtures were suspended on Friday but will resume on Saturday, including the ongoing Test match between England and South Africa. The government has stated that there is "no obligation" to postpone events.

329.title: Kapil Sharma's 'Zwigato' to screen at Busan Film Festival
329.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma's film 'Zwigato' is all set for its Asian premiere at the 27th Busan International Film Festival. The news was shared by Applause Entertainment, the production house bankrolling 'Zwigato', on their Instagram handle. The Nandita Das directorial was earlier screened at the Toronto International Film Festival. Kapil plays a food delivery partner in the movie.

330.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is for spreading hatred: BJP leader
330.article_body: BJP MP Jugal Thakor Lokhandwala has criticised Rahul Gandhi's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and said it is 'Nafarat failayo Yatra'. "This journey of Rahul Gandhi is to spread hatred," he said. "The way Congress has done the work of dividing the country into caste, region and religion for 60 years, even today, they want to run the same politics," Lokhandwala added.

331.title: Queen Elizabeth's state funeral will be UK's first since 1965
331.article_body: The state funeral that'll be accorded to the late Queen Elizabeth II will be the UK's first such funeral since 1965, with Winston Churchill being the last head of state to get the honour. The Queen's husband Prince Philip was given a royal ceremonial funeral. A state funeral begins with the body of the deceased brought on a gun carriage.

332.title: 3rd England-SA Test to resume on Saturday after suspension due to Queen's death
332.article_body: The third and deciding Test between England and South Africa will resume at The Oval on Saturday after the play was suspended on Friday following Queen Elizabeth II's demise. "All players...coaches will wear black armbands," the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) said. After the opening day's play was washed out, Saturday's play will be considered to be Day 3.

333.title: 4 people killed after car falls into gorge in Uttarakhand
333.article_body: Four people from Maharashtra were killed and two others injured when the car in which they were travelling fell into a gorge near Shree Ram Tapasthali Ashram in Tehri Garhwal, Uttarakhand. The deceased have been identified as Shivaji Budhkar (53) from Mumbai, Purushottam Dattatreya (37) and Jitesh Lokhande (43) from Thane, and Dharmaraj from Palghar, police said.

334.title: Gambling ring busted in Karnataka's Kalaburagi; 7 held, cash seized
334.article_body: Police have arrested seven persons for gambling in a public space while playing a game of 'Andar Bahar' near Shahabazar Naka in Karnataka's Kalaburagi. Police also seized the deck of cards, along with cash of over ₹1 lakh, they added. The Kalaburagi City Police tweeted and shared the details of the case, along with a press note and pictures.

335.title: 15 passengers injured after 2 buses collide in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
335.article_body: At least 15 passengers were injured when a government bus collided with a minibus of a private transport service in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Friday, police said. The accident took place in the afternoon when the bus was travelling to Jalandhar from Pathankot, police added. Ten of the injured passengers were discharged from community health centre after getting first aid.

336.title: Was called 'lady Akshay Kumar' as I was doing 4-5 films in a year: Rakul
336.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh in an interview called herself a "workaholic" and said, "When I was working in Telugu films, I did four-five films in a year." "People would jokingly call me 'lady Akshay Kumar'," she added. "I live, breathe and dream cinema, so I'm extremely grateful that I have work. I will never say no to work," said Rakul.

337.title: DK was dropped without any fault of his, Ind should have trusted him: Jaffer
337.article_body: Former cricketer Wasim Jaffer commented on the Indian team's move to drop wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik from the playing XI for majority of the Asia Cup matches. "Karthik was dropped without any of his faults. He didn't even bat in the matches he played...I think team India will be hurt that they didn't show that trust in Karthik," Jaffer said.

338.title: 12-yr-old boy killed in leopard attack in UP's Balrampur
338.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was killed in a leopard attack in Pachperwa town in Balrampur, UP. The incident took place on Thursday night when the deceased, Aman, was returning home, police said. The forest department has been directed to catch the leopard and a team of officials has been sent to provide financial compensation to Aman's family.

339.title: Under no pressure to breach 90m mark: Neeraj after Diamond Trophy win
339.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, who became the first-ever Indian to win Diamond Trophy after throwing 88.44 metres, said he's under no pressure to breach the 90 metres mark. "It'll happen when it has to," he added. "Medal is more important than the mark. People don't remember the distance, they remember where you finished on...podium," he further said.

340.title: 'Corrupt' to meet same fate as 'rioters': UP CM Yogi Adityanath
340.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday warned the 'corrupt' saying they would meet the same fate as 'rioters'. Criticising the previous governments, he said, "The 'daam' (price) of every 'kaam' (work) was already fixed. The racket had made the entire system hollow, by acting like a weevil." "Corruption was in the genes of governments before 2017," he added.

341.title: What is the story behind the black-and-white photo used to announce Queen's death?
341.article_body: The news of Queen Elizabeth II's death was officially announced on social media with a black-and-white photo. According to People, the photograph was clicked more than 15 years ago during a milestone event in the Queen's life. It was clicked at Buckingham Palace in February 2006 for the Queen's 80th birthday by late photographer Jane Bown.

342.title: Ashish Nehra names his Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022
342.article_body: Ex-India fast bowler Ashish Nehra has named his Team India squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Nehra included Ravindra Jadeja, Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravichandran Ashwin as spinners in the squad. He also named both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik in the squad. Nehra further said that he would want Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul to open in the tournament.

343.title: Didn't use my chances: Sabalenka on US Open semis loss vs Swiatek
343.article_body: After failing to get past a Grand Slam semi-final for the third time in her career at US Open 2022, world number six Aryna Sabalenka said she didn't use her chances against top seed Iga Swiatek on Thursday. "She was playing aggressively," she added. It was the fourth time in 2022 that Sabalenka was defeated by the 21-year-old Pole.

344.title: Feels like we have lost our own 'Grand mother': Vaughan on Queen's demise
344.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan shared his views on the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. "Feels like we have all lost our own Grand mother xxxxx," Vaughan tweeted. "She loved sport, be honoured to play in her memory," England's current Test skipper Ben Stokes tweeted. Former English cricketer Ian Bell also offered his condolences on the Queen's demise.

345.title: Mill worker dies after colleague pumps air into his rectum in MP
345.article_body: A mill worker died after his colleague allegedly pumped air into his rectum with an air compressor machine that was being used to clean flour dust in Madhya Pradesh's Satna. The accused, who was arrested on Friday, had done it "with an intention of fun", according to police. The victim had asked the accused to help him clean his back.

346.title: Country's politics should be free from dynastic politics: Assam CM
346.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday criticised Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao and said the country's politics should be free from dynasty politics. Speaking in Hyderabad, Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "CM KCR speaks about BJP-free politics but we speak about dynasty-free politics." "We still see pictures of his son and daughter in Hyderabad," Sarma added.

347.title: Which Indians have slammed hundreds in all formats in international cricket?
347.article_body: Virat Kohli on Thursday became the fourth Indian cricketer to smash hundreds in all three formats in international cricket. Suresh Raina had become the first cricketer to achieve the feat in 2010. Rohit Sharma became the second Indian to slam hundreds in all three formats in 2015. Meanwhile, KL Rahul became the third Indian to achieve the feat in 2016.

348.title: Tripura SIT to probe Bangladeshi infiltration after 27 arrests
