348.article_body: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) of Tripura Police will probe the infiltration from Bangladesh into the state after 27 allegedly illegal foreign nationals were detained near Agartala earlier this week. Officials said the move will ensure better coordination between the police and central government agencies. An official said infiltration is being reported from the state's unfenced border areas.

349.title: Cristiano Ronaldo mourns Queen Elizabeth II's death, says 'Irreplaceable loss'
349.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo took to Instagram to condole the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. Calling it an "irreplaceable loss", he wrote, "Seven years of my career were played in the Premier League, making this my 8th season living in England. Throughout these years, I've felt the everlasting love of the UK for its Queen."

350.title: SC to begin hearings on criminalising marital rape from Sept 16
350.article_body: The Supreme Court said it will on September 16 hear pleas arising out of the Delhi HC's split verdict on criminalising marital rape. "Otherwise also, this matter has to be heard," said the bench. The HC had delivered a verdict with one judge favouring striking down the exception in the law while the other refused to hold it unconstitutional.

351.title: Army, Air Force conduct 4-day 'Gagan Strike' exercise in Punjab
351.article_body: The Army's Kharga Corps and the Air Force conducted a joint exercise called 'Gagan Strike' over the last four days in Punjab. The exercise comprised deploying attack helicopters in support of ground forces and practising annihilation of enemy defences, a defence spokesperson said. The Apache 64E and Advanced Light Helicopter WSI were used by the Air Force.

352.title: CUET-UG results to be announced by September 15: UGC Chairman
352.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) is expected to announce the CUET-UG results by September 15 or if possible, even a couple of days earlier, University Grants Commission (UGC) Chairman Jagadesh Kumar said on Friday. The Common University Entrance Test for undergraduate admissions (CUET-UG) was conducted in six phases from July 15-August 30. CUET-UG answer keys were released on September 8.

353.title: Virat Kohli will always be remembered as the greatest cricketer: Akhtar
353.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said Virat Kohli will always be remembered as the "greatest" cricketer, following his 71st international hundred in the match against Afghanistan. Akhtar further termed Kohli as a man made of "steel", adding his wife Anushka Sharma is an "iron lady". "You always support the truth and that's why nothing bad will happen to you," stated Akhtar.

354.title: Jeff Bezos criticises US professor for wishing Queen Elizabeth an 'excruciating' death
354.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos criticised an associate professor at US' Carnegie Mellon University who said she wished UK's Queen Elizabeth faced "excruciating" pain on her death bed. "This is someone supposedly working to make the world better?" said Bezos on Uju Anya's tweet, adding, "I don't think so." The Queen passed away in Balmoral Castle, Scotland on Thursday.

355.title: Self-proclaimed SP student leader tries to block UP CM's convoy, detained
355.article_body: A self-proclaimed Samajwadi Party (SP) student leader was detained for trying to block the convoy of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Jaunpur on Friday. The accused broke the police cordon and suddenly appeared in front of the convoy waving a black flag and raising slogans in favour of SP chief Akhilesh Yadav. He was immediately taken away by police.

356.title: I have stopped working with A-list actors: Filmmaker Prakash Jha
356.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha has said he has stopped working with A-list actors. "They don't want to work with me either," he added. "I don't want to finish a film in 30 days...because the actor wants to move on to another project. I want to do my project the way I want. Many don't want to work on...difficult script," said Prakash.

357.title: Told Serena 'No disrespect to this generation but you're so much better': Sharapova
357.article_body: Five-time Grand Slam champion Maria Sharapova said she told Serena Williams when the pair met at 2021 Met Gala that there's no disrespect to the current generation of tennis players but "you're so much better". "I'm glad that she had a chance here [US Open 2022]," she added. The 23-time Grand Slam champion was defeated in US Open third round.

358.title: Hugh Jackman's 'The Son' gets 10-min standing ovation at Venice Film Fest
358.article_body: Hugh Jackman and Laura Dern-starrer 'The Son' received a 10-minute standing ovation at Venice International Film Festival on Wednesday. The film, directed by Florian Zeller, centres on "a family as it falls apart and tries to come back together again", according to Sony Pictures Classics' official synopsis. Actors Anthony Hopkins and Vanessa Kirby are also part of 'The Son'.

359.title: 4 men open fire at street dogs in Madhya Pradesh; case registered
359.article_body: A case has been registered against four unidentified persons after they allegedly opened fire at street dogs using air guns at a locality in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. A video of the incident showing the accused firing shots at the dogs went viral on social media. No canines were, however, injured in the firing, police said.

360.title: Old days of Lalu Yadav's regime are back in Bihar: Sushil Modi
360.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi commented on the alleged increasing incidents of murder in the JD(U)-RJD-ruled Bihar. "Recently, incidents of murder took place in Patna. It seems like the old days of Lalu Yadav's regime are back," Modi said. He added, "He (Bihar CM) met Lalu Yadav, the symbol of crime and corruption. They can't handle law and order."

361.title: We are for corporate India but against massive monopolies: Rahul
361.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said that his party is for "corporate India" but "against the idea of massive monopolies". "India now faces a bankruptcy of vision for what the future of our country should be...We are against unfairness, be it against farmers or MSMEs. We will act to ensure fairness prevails," Rahul tweeted.

362.title: TMC leader Mondal, 13 others acquitted in 2010 WB poll violence case
362.article_body: A Kolkata court on Friday cited "lack of evidence" while acquitting Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Anubrata Mondal and 13 others in the 2010 Mangalkote poll violence case. In 2010, CPI(M) activists were allegedly injured in a clash with TMC supporters in West Bengal. The prosecution couldn't prove that the accused were present at the scene of violence, the court held.

363.title: Pakistan's Asif Ali, Afghanistan's Fareed Ahmad fined 25% of match fee for their fight
363.article_body: Pakistan's Asif Ali and Afghanistan's Fareed Ahmad have been fined 25% of their match fee each for their altercation during their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match. Ahmad gave Asif a send-off after dismissing him, after which Asif pushed and almost hit Ahmad with the bat. The players admitted their offence and accepted sanctions proposed by match referee Andy Pycroft.

364.title: Man confronts Assam CM on stage during Hyd rally, dismantles mic
364.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma was allegedly confronted by a man, who dismantled the microphone on the stage at a rally in Hyderabad on Friday, as per reports. The man has reportedly been identified as a worker of the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) party. He was later taken off stage by BJP leaders and workers present there, reports added.

365.title: Earth spiralling towards multiple 'irreversible' climate tipping points: Study
365.article_body: With the current warming rate, Earth might cross several climate tipping points by the 2030s, a study has found. According to researchers, climate tipping points are threshold conditions beyond which climate change becomes irreversible and "self-perpetuating". To cut risks and maintain liveable conditions on Earth, greenhouse gas emissions must be reduced rapidly, starting immediately, they said.

366.title: Nepal captain Sandeep issues statement after being accused of rape, says 'I'm innocent'
366.article_body: Nepal cricket team captain Sandeep Lamichhane, who has been accused of raping a 17-year-old girl in a hotel room in Kathmandu, issued a statement, saying he is innocent. He added that he will be taking a break from Caribbean Premier League and go back to Nepal. "May justice be served to the innocent and right investigation be done," he stated.

367.title: Rohit interviews Virat Kohli after his 1st hundred in nearly 3 years, BCCI shares video
367.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma interviewed Virat Kohli after the latter slammed his first hundred in nearly three years. After Rohit asked a question in Hindi, Kohli jokingly responded, "He's speaking in pure Hindi with me for the first time." In the interview, Kohli talked about how the team management gave him space and helped him amid his poor form.

368.title: Army's forward posts along LAC in Arunachal Pradesh to get helipads
368.article_body: Infantry battalions guarding the Line of Actual Control (LAC) with China in Arunachal Pradesh are going to get helipads capable of operating Chinook helicopters for swift mobilisation of troops and military equipment, senior military officials said on Friday. "We're...giving a big push to the infrastructure development in the forward areas in the eastern sector," a Mountain Brigade Commander said.

369.title: Hard to comprehend Queen Elizabeth is no longer with us: World Athletics Prez
369.article_body: Condoling the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, World Athletics President Sebastian Coe tweeted, "The Queen was such a beloved constant in the lives of so many people over so many years that it's hard to comprehend that she's no longer with us." He added, "I'll never forget her total commitment to...success of the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games."

370.title: Royal gun salutes of 96 rounds, marking each year of Queen's life, fired across UK
370.article_body: A day after Queen Elizabeth II passed away on Thursday, Royal gun salutes took place at various places, including London, Belfast, Cardiff and Edinburgh, in the UK. The salutes saw the firing of 96 rounds, marking each year of the Queen's life. The UK is observing a 10-day period of official mourning, starting today (September 9).

371.title: I'm going for everything: Jabeur on her 2nd Grand Slam final at US Open
371.article_body: After reaching her second straight Grand Slam final at US Open 2022, Tunisia's Ons Jabeur said the Wimbledon final was tough for her, adding that she's "going for everything" against world number one Iga Swiatek in Saturday's final in New York. Jabeur became the first African woman to reach the final at US Open in the Open Era.

372.title: BJP has made Bengaluru a city of shutdowns: Karnataka Congress
372.article_body: The Karnataka unit of Congress criticised the BJP's state unit for the ongoing flood crisis in Bengaluru. "From the silicon & startup capital of India, BJP has ensured we have become the city of shutdowns. The government's inefficiency is hurting our city," Congress tweeted. A photo stating "infrastructure disconnected" was also shared by Congress in the tweet.

373.title: BJP is responsible for it: NCP leader on Yakub Memon's grave controversy
373.article_body: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil has held the BJP responsible for the controversy over beautification of 1993 Mumbai blast convict Yakub Memon's grave. "It's important to see during whose tenure permission was granted to build his grave," Patil said. "[It] was built when BJP was in power in Centre and also in Maharashtra. They are responsible for it," he added.

374.title: Yo Yo Honey Singh pays ₹1 crore alimony for divorce settlement
374.article_body: Rapper Yo Yo Honey Singh's divorce with Shalini Talwar has been finalised. He has paid an alimony of ₹1 crore for the divorce settlement. In 2021, Shalini Talwar had alleged domestic violence, mental harassment, cheating and financial fraud against Honey Singh, following which he had issued a statement saying "the truth will be out soon".

375.title: Have done nothing wrong, cooperated fully: Think tank CPR on I-T raids
375.article_body: Days after the Income Tax Department conducted searches at the Delhi office of the Centre for Policy Research (CPR), the think tank on Friday said, "We hold ourselves to the highest standards of compliance and are confident that we've done nothing wrong." "We have extended full cooperation to the department...and will continue to do so in the future," they added.

376.title: President Murmu launches 'Pradhan Mantri TB Mukt Bharat Abhiyaan'
376.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu virtually launched the 'Pradhan Mantri TB Mukt Bharat Abhiyaan' on Friday to strengthen the mission to eliminate tuberculosis from India by 2025. The President noted that India has more than 25% of the total TB patients of the world. The campaign seeks to bring together all community stakeholders to support TB patients who are on treatment.

377.title: People like CM Baghel only want to fill treasures of Congress: JP Nadda
377.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda criticised Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel and said people like him are against development and only want to fill Congress' treasures. "Our tribal brothers were killed here and...Baghel was with Rahul Gandhi in Kerala," Nadda said. "These days, [he] is going to 'Bharat Jodo' rallies, they need to first align their own party," he added.

378.title: Was surprised: Badshah on Apple using his Voodoo song at Far Out event
378.article_body: Rapper Badshah, speaking about Apple using his 'Voodoo' song at the Far Out event, said he was happy and surprised to see his song being used at the event. "I'm really happy...that Voodoo has crossed over and has such a long life," he added. Badshah's song with J Balvin and Tainy was used to unveil the brand's latest AirPods.

379.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
379.article_body: The IMD has issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states over next few days. It's very likely over Andhra Pradesh, Puducherry and Telangana on Saturday. It's likely over Odisha on September 10 and 11, West Bengal on September 11 and 12, and Gujarat from September 11 to 13. Maharashtra and Goa may witness it over next five days.

380.title: NGT imposes ₹200 cr fine on Ghaziabad civic, development bodies
380.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has imposed fine of ₹200 crore on Ghaziabad Nagar Nigam (municipality) and Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) for "far from satisfactory" management of sewage waste. The municipality's liability will be 75% and the GDA's will be 25%. The tribunal said the two city bodies are liable to pay compensation for restoration of environment.

381.title: Conductor slaps, kicks passenger out of KSRTC bus; video surfaces
381.article_body: A video has surfaced online, purportedly showing the conductor of a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus allegedly slapping and kicking a passenger out of the vehicle in Dakshina Kannada district. KSRTC authorities have issued a disciplinary inquiry against the bus conductor and suspended him from duty. As per reports, the passenger was in an inebriated state.

382.title: How freaking good is this: Anushka on 'Vikram Vedha' trailer
382.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to her Instagram Stories to praise the trailer of 'Vikram Vedha', an upcoming Hindi film starring Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan in the lead roles. "How freaking good is this trailer! Two favourites in one film, totally killing it, Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan," she wrote. The film is set to release on September 30.

383.title: Reply to pleas against Places of Worship Act in 2 weeks: SC to govt
383.article_body: The Supreme Court granted the Centre two weeks' time to respond to petitions challenging sections of the Places of Worship Act, 1991. The bench accepted all pleas filed in the matter, including Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind's intervention plea. The original plea challenges the law prohibiting changes in the character of a place of worship from what it was on August 15, 1947.

384.title: Delhi govt to restore, beautify 50 lakes: Dy CM Manish Sisodia
384.article_body: Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said that the Delhi government will restore and beautify 50 lakes under its limits to turn them into recreational spots for tourists and citizens. Sisodia reviewed the Sannoth Lake restoration work in Bawana on Thursday. Recycled water from the sewage treatment plant in the Ghogha drain is being used to revive the lake.

385.title: Principal suspended after video shows students cleaning school toilet in UP
385.article_body: The principal of a primary school in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia was suspended after a video showing students being forced to clean a toilet surfaced on social media, an official said. Block Education Officer of Sohaon was asked to probe the matter. The video reportedly showed a man scolding children and threatening to lock the toilet if they did not obey.

386.title: 17 kids, 2 teachers fall ill allegedly due to foul smell from cowshed in UP
386.article_body: A total of 17 students and two teachers from a school in Dankaur area of Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar fell ill on Thursday. The school's director has alleged that due to a lack of cleanliness in the nearby cowshed, a foul smell was enveloping the school, as a result of which, the students and teachers have fallen ill.

387.title: Navneet Rana defaming me: Maha girl allegedly caught in 'love jihad'
387.article_body: A 19-year-old woman from Maharashtra's Amravati, who had reportedly gone missing, sparking 'love jihad' allegations, has come out and said MP Navneet Rana is "defaming" her. The woman said she had not eloped and had left her house to inquire about some educational courses. The woman's parents had filed a missing person complaint leading to the detention of a man.

388.title: Guard of children's home booked after specially-abled boy killed in Mumbai
388.article_body: Weeks after four minor boys allegedly beat a 16-year-old specially-abled inmate to death at a children's home in Mumbai, the police have registered a case of negligence against the security guard. "The guard was not present in the isolation room to supervise their behaviour," an official said. The guard has been booked under Section 15 of Juvenile Justice Act.

389.title: Strict action will be taken: CM Shinde on Yakub Memon's grave beautification
389.article_body: Responding to the controversy over the beautification of 1993 Mumbai blast convict Yakub Memon's grave, Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said that strict action will be taken against the persons responsible. "Yakub Memon...cannot be glorified. We won't accept this or let it happen," Shinde said. "I've informed BMC and...police, the Home Ministry will take appropriate action," he added.

390.title: Man threatens to blow up mosque & shoot its cleric in UP; arrested
390.article_body: A 25-year-old man named Mohammad Samad has been arrested for allegedly threatening to blow up the Jama Masjid in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly and shoot the cleric of the mosque, police said on Friday. A threat letter had been pasted on the mosque's wall because the cleric had not allowed the accused to play DJ in Eid Milad-un-Nabi procession, police added.

391.title: Pune-Nashik high-speed rail project is a priority: MP Amol Kolhe
391.article_body: The Pune-Nashik high-speed railway project is getting priority at all levels as it will connect northern and southern states, running through key industrial areas, Shirur MP Amol Kolhe said. "We are hoping it will prove to be the fastest railway project in terms of execution," he said. The project's land acquisition has been completed in four villages of Haveli taluka.

392.title: He's better off at no. 3: Pujara on Kohli's batting position in T20 WC
392.article_body: When asked if Virat Kohli, who scored his first T20I century in Asia Cup against Afghanistan, should open the innings in T20 World Cup, Cheteshwar Pujara said the India batter is better off at the number three spot. "KL Rahul...Rohit Sharma I think they make a good pair...as an opening...partner," he added. Kohli opened India's innings alongside Rahul against Afghanistan.

393.title: 1,183 gms of gold worth ₹61.62 lakh seized at Hyderabad airport
393.article_body: Customs officials at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport caught a male passenger who was smuggling gold and have seized 1,183 grams of gold valued at ₹61.62 lakh. The passenger was trying to smuggle the gold in the form of paste by concealing it in undergarments and socks, Hyderabad Customs tweeted.

394.title: Swiggy agent, Hyd man attack each other with knife over late delivery
394.article_body: A Swiggy delivery agent was allegedly attacked by a customer with a knife for being late in Hyderabad amid heavy rains on Thursday. After being attacked, the agent reportedly took the knife from the customer and attacked him with it. The customer, Shiva Prasad, received neck injuries and was hospitalised. The police are yet to trace the delivery agent.

395.title: BJP shares pic of Rahul's ₹41,000 Burberry t-shirt, Congress replies
395.article_body: BJP on Friday shared a picture of Rahul Gandhi wearing a Burberry t-shirt, which purportedly costs ₹41,257, while on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. BJP's Twitter handle shared the picture and said, "Bharat, dekho! (Bharat, look!)." Congress responded to the tweet, saying, "If you want to discuss clothes, the discussion will move towards (PM Narendra) Modi ji's ₹10 lakh suit."

396.title: King Charles to be formally proclaimed as Britain's new monarch on Saturday
396.article_body: King Charles will be officially proclaimed as Britain's new monarch at a meeting of the Accession Council at St James's Palace on Saturday, Reuters reported citing Buckingham Palace. Charles, Queen Elizabeth II's eldest son, automatically became King upon his mother's demise. He left for London from Balmoral Castle in Scotland on Friday.

397.title: Russian airstrike hits hospital in Sumy, several wounded: Ukraine
397.article_body: A Russian airstrike hit a hospital in Ukraine's Sumy region on Friday morning, the region's Governor Dmytro Zhyvytsky said. The building was destroyed and several people were wounded in the strike, he added. The hospital is reportedly located in the Velyka Pysarivka district, which lies on Ukraine's border with Russia. Moscow had previously denied allegations that it has targeted civilians.

398.title: It's a wrong thought process: Sehwag on India dropping Shami from T20Is
398.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag said that management's move to drop pacer Mohammad Shami from the Asia Cup was a "wrong thought process". "Two years ago, even [Ravichandran] Ashwin wasn't in your plans...When Avesh [Khan] was unavailable, Shami [should] have played. I understand you want to give youngsters a chance, but in Australia you also need experience," Sehwag said.

399.title: Rohit, Dravid don't fancy Shami in T20Is: Ajay Jadeja
399.article_body: Former cricketer Ajay Jadeja said that Indian skipper Rohit Sharma and coach Rahul Dravid "don't fancy" pacer Mohammad Shami in their T20I plans. "It is clear that [they]...want to play in a certain way. So, it doesn't matter what I think of Shami and it is too late to make that change now," Jadeja said.

400.title: 4 arrested with cough syrup worth ₹1.42 lakh in Palghar
400.article_body: Four persons were arrested allegedly with cough syrup worth ₹1.42 lakh in Palghar, Maharashtra. The accused were allegedly carrying several boxes of cough syrup in a tempo and were later arrested after they could not give satisfactory answers on the consignment, an official said. They have been charged under Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act, the official added.
